loans.name: Gaudy

texts.en: Gaudy is 45 years old and married with five children. She is a nurse by profession. She comes from Kicuzi Ibanda District. Besides being a nurse, Gaudy also deals in cattle fattening as her side source of income. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,00 UGX to help her buy more cows for fattening and use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children, and also provide them with their basic needs. Her challenges are the inadequate capital to run her business and competition from other farmers. She hopes with the financial boost, she will soon overcome the challenges. Gaudy is an honest and hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy more cows for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair products.

loans.name: Majid Hussain

texts.en:
Majid Hussain is the age of 30; he lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is the sole earner of his family and responsible to financially support the family. 

He works in dairy products such as milk, curd, and butter for sale. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities with his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through the milk sales business. So, Majid Hussain requested a loan. In this way, he would be able to buy a buffalo for his milk sales business.

He thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for his milk sales business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo quien trabaja como jornalero. Reyna se dedica a la venta de variedad de verduras y carne desde hace 23 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar. Reyna solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda como encementar el piso y comparar ventanas para la misma. Con el monto solicitado comprará  cemento, arena, gravas y ventanas. Espera poder contar el apoyo y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Reyna  is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, who works as a day laborer. Reyna has been selling a variety of vegetables and meat for 23 years. She sells her food as a street vendor, and this is how she and her husband support their household expenses.

Reyna  is requesting this loan from FUSAI, as she wishes to improve their housing conditions by cementing the floor and buying windows for the home. 

With the amount requested, she will buy cement, sand, gravel and windows to install in their home.  She hopes to be able to have the support, and this way begin the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel for cementing her floor, as well as windows to install in her home.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 47 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella requested a loan of PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

Estrella is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages four and two. He is a police officer by profession and recently opened a Zoona money-transfer business. His business provides financial services to people in his community.

Charles loves his business because it gives him the chance to interact with other small business owners. The business helps Charles to pay bills and provide for his family. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him purchase a Zoona branded trading booth. This will help Charles to save on rental costs.

This is Charles’ first Kiva loan. He is grateful for this opportunity and explains this will help him to save and make sure his place is easily located. His dream is to expand his business by opening more Zoona outlets in Lusaka, Zambia.

loans.use: To help him purchase a Zoona branded trading booth

loans.name: Marta Angelica

texts.es: Marta de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida apoyándose en su tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en la cual vende productos como: golosinas, café, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, condimentos, etc. Marta desea construir un baño lavable en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una taza lavable, cemento, arena, grava, hierro para construir un servicio sanitario lavable en su vivienda.
texts.en: Marta, 30, lives in the home she owns with her husband and their 3 children, ages 5, 3 and 2. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living through her store selling basic goods like groceries, coffee, sugar, rice, beans, condiments, etc. Marta wants to build an indoor bathroom in her home, so she has asked FUSAI for a loan to buy a sink, cement, sand, gravel and iron.

loans.use: to buy a sink, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build an indoor bathroom.

loans.name: Genalin

texts.en:
Genalin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Genalin successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Genalin's business profile again for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is the age of 44, living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of four children. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops in his land and gets fruitful outputs from his crops. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice, cotton and wheat crops. 

He wants to use some agrochemicals for the better production in his crops of wheat and rice. Sometimes he has to spray his crops to protect against harmful bacteria. So, he is in need of some agrochemicals for the betterment of his agriculture business. For this purpose, he has to bear some additional amount. Therefore, Riaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals for his crops

loans.name: Jorge Marcelo

texts.es: Jorge de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y 3 hermanos. Él es un joven que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres y hermanos económicamente, apoyándose en su trabajo como carpintero el cual realiza en su vivienda elaborando muebles como: gaveteros, roperos, juegos de comedor, etc. Dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Jorge habita en una vivienda humilde a base de madera y lamina pero siente que es bastante insegura por lo que desea construir un cuarto dormitorio de cemento en su propiedad, pero al no contar con los recursos económicos necesarios solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su propiedad
texts.en:
Jorge, aged 27, lives in his own home with his parents and three brothers.

He is a young man who, through his hard work and determination, has managed to get ahead and support his parents and brothers by working as a carpenter. He works at home making furniture such as cabinets, wardrobes, dining room sets, and the like. He has been following said occupation for 10 years now, so he has a good amount of clients ordering his products.

Jorge lives in a humble house made out of timber and metal sheeting—materials he feels render the house quite unsafe. For this reason, he wants to build a concrete bedroom in his property. Since he cannot afford to do so, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a bedroom in his property.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a bedroom in his property.

loans.name: Edwards Israel

texts.es:
Edwards vive actualmente con su madre y sus dos hermanos. Su padre falleció en el año 2008. Su madre tiene una pequeña bodega en casa de la cual genera ingresos promedio que le permiten sostener a su familia. 

Debido a la muerte de su padre, Edwards tuvo que dejar de estudiar por 4 meses por problemas económicos, es por tal motivo que está recurriendo al apoyo de KIVA para que pueda culminar su carrera que tanto le gusta y por la cual siente una gran pasión ya que le permitirá lograr sus objetivos personales y profesionales en la vida, para así poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente se encuentra cursando el último ciclo de la Carrera de Metal Mecánica, gracias al apoyo de su madre, pero debido a la situación económica que viene atravesando pide el apoyo a KIVA para poder culminar su carrera con éxito y empiece así a trabajar para poder ayudar con los ingresos para su hogar.

Edwards piensa que la acción que realiza KIVA mediante Programa de Créditos Educativos, son fáciles de solicitar sin muchos obstáculos a comparación con otros programas y estaría agradecido por el gran apoyo que espera le brinden para que así pueda culminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Edwards currently lives with his mother and two brothers; his father died in 2008. His mother has a small store in their home that generates income that allows her to sustain her family. 

Thanks to his mother's support, he is in his last cycle of a degree in Metal Mechanics; but his current economic situation requires that he ask for help from KIVA in order to finish successfully and begin working so he can start contributing financially to his household. 

Edward is doing his technical degree with SENATI, one of Peru's premier technical degree programs. 95% of SENATI students find employment within their technical degree within 3 months of graduation. For this reason, and because of a promising labor market, Edward feels this is a good investment in his future.

Because of the death of his father, Edwards had to defer his studies for 4 months due to economic issues. For that reason he is asking for the support of KIVA so that he can finish his degree which he loves and is passionate about. This will allow him to achieve his personal and professional life goals, and allow him to help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for the last semester of his tuition for a degree in mechanical engineering, so that he can graduate as a fully trained professional.

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Fadhil, who is in his early 30s, is single.  He has been selling second-hand clothes for four years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Fadhil's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan. He used the profit to take care of his health, saved some in his bank account and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase second-hand clothes stock to resell. He dreams of buying a plot of land to build his own house. 

Fadhil will share this loan with his loan group, "Malumbo," which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock of second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky settled for living in Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 60 and had four children.

She has been helping her husband working on their farm to make a living. With her generated income and savings, Vicky was able to put up a retail business and has been running it for over two years. They make a good income from these activities and with the determination of improving their income, they work hard on it with GDMPC as their partner. 

She wants to augment their living situation. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. Her dream for the future is to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a 48-year-old married woman from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanical engineer and gets a fixed salary. In spite of her professional education, Lela was unable to start any stable job. So, she decided to be involved in her own business and generate her own income. Now Lela needs financial support, and that's why she requested a loan. Her loan application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, named the Start Up program, that gives a chance for people to start or re-start businesses. Lela has already found a place for opening a stationery store and also have Xeroxing services. 

She will use this requested amount of 2,000 GEL (Georgia lari) for purchasing stock of stationery products and to have money for working capital. The business will be profitable, she thinks, as it has a good location and is the only business of this kind in the area.
 
After opening the store, Lela will be able to be employed, generate her own income and do her bit for the family's welfare. She will be thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to become financially independent.

loans.use: To open a stationery store and have Xeroxing services for getting her own income

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a 60-year-old married woman from Balasan, Iloilo. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband.
 
For more than 15 years, the business has been sustained, becoming their source of income until a super typhoon hit the country several months ago and ravaged thousands of businesses including Jasmin's fishing venture. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional ingredients for her food vending business like flour, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables and other items. Jasmin believes that with the help of CEVI, a micro finance in the Philippines, her dreams of making her business more sustainable becomes possible. 

In the future, Jasmin wants to improve the general living standards of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero y sus 2 hijos una niña de 9 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una joven que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos con el apoyo de su compañero de vida, además ella se gana la vida vendiendo granos básicos y gas propano en su cantón. Reina desea construir una champa para la cocina y encementar el piso de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, madera, clavos, cemento, arena y grava para construir una champa para la cocina y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reina, 24, lives in her own home with her husband and two children: a 9 year old girl and a 7 year old boy. Thanks to her hard work and tenacity, and the support of her spouse, this young woman has been able to help her children get ahead. She sells basic grains and propane gas to earn a living.

Reina wants to build a cooking hut and to lay a cement floor in her home, which is why she has asked FUSAI for a loan to help buy: tin sheeting, wood, nails, cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to buy tin sheeting, wood, nails, cement, sand and gravel to build a cooking hut and lay a cement floor in the home.

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.en:
Fransisco is a 35-year-old married man with four children. Francis deals in agriculture and alcohol brewing, which are his main sources of income. He has managed to look after his family with the basic necessities of life and taken all his children to school through the income earned from his agriculture business.

Fransisco has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to help him improve his agriculture activities through pruning and mulching his banana plants so that they can yield highly. He will use a small portion of the money to complete payment of tuition for his children in secondary school. He will soon overcome his challenges if he continues to get a financial boost.

loans.use: To hire labor and buy mulch for his banana plants, and pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized tin sheeting and to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel does dairy farming and has been in this business for 10 years now. He is 62 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with nine children. He will use this loan to buy a dairy cow and increase his stock of dairy cows. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his rental housing business.

This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to grow his business and own apartments, which he will be renting.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. Rumbidzai has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition to this, Rumbidzai rents a shop at the local market where she sells products such as clothes and footwear. She has been running this business for three months now, and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the Kiva loan, Rumbidzai will purchase more clothes and footwear to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cacao crop and keep up the land.

loans.name: Eudiviges Margarita

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara diferentes platos como sopas y pollos al horno,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,verduras y pollo para cocinar para su restaurant.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The lending club member has a restaurant where she makes different dishes like soups and baked chickens. She hopes this business will help her to get ahead. She asks for a loan to buy rice, vegetables and chicken to cook in her restaurant. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables and chicken to cook in her restaurant.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos y productos de belleza,la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios quiere salira adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos y productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comptar zapatos,lapiz labiales y cremas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Ernestina, continues to work in her business selling shoes and beauty products. With these small businesses, she hopes to get ahead. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the shoes and beauty products. She is requesting the loan to buy shoes, lipsticks and lotions. 

The member is happy about the loan and promises to comply with all her payments.

loans.use: To buy shoes, lipsticks and lotions.

loans.name: Phanies

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Phanies, 31, who has persevered against the odds to become a respected farmer in Bonyunyu, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. 

Phanies, who is single and a mother of one, always encourages farmers in her village to persevere, conquer fear, work hard and engage in farming. For the past eight years, Phanies has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her primary sources of income are milk selling, egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

Although she loves dairy farming, she passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” Because of the good profits she earns from poultry farming, she has turned into a beacon of success for many women who seek advice on poultry farming. 

Because of her high-quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound, and the demand for poultry eggs and meat has been overwhelming. To be able to meet the demand, Phanies is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity, and hence, satisfy the demand. The love for poultry meat and eggs has grown in Nyamira at a staggering pace. 

Phanies will use her increased income to improve her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from more poultry manure, which she will use in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and hence, provide a solid education to her child.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for growing vegetables

loans.name: Olindina

texts.en: Olindina lives in Suai. She is married with three children and her husband is in agriculture. She has been involved in business activities since 1999. She started with her own working capital of $7. She is requesting a loan of $700, because she has a kiosk and she wants to buy more goods such as  toothpaste, soaps, medicine, biscuits, detergents, sugar, sardines, milk, cooking oils, candies and other things to sell Including soft drinks. She is very interested in her business.  She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She needs to take this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her income in the future. Olindina also raises animals at her place like buffalo, cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her general store

loans.name: German

texts.es: El Señor German vive en el trópico de Cochabamba junto a su padre y hermano,llego de Sucre en busca de mejores oportunidades de vida para poder salir adelante, en la zona tropical trabaja dedicándose al rubro agrícola en terreno alquilado desde hace dos años, produce papaya la cual cuida con mucha dedicación para obtener buenas cosechas, el producto lo comercializa en el mismo lugar de la actividad económica a comerciantes de fruta, con los ingresos generados de su producción ya se compró su propio terreno urbano pero quiere seguir creciendo económicamente, por lo cual decidió ampliar la producción de papaya que además es de fácil cuidado es por ello que requiere un crédito para poder comprar plantines de papaya ya que cuenta con terreno bien preparado para realizar la plantación, de esta forma lograra sus objetivos propuestos y tendra mayores ingresos para poder realizar otras actividades.
texts.en:
German lives in the tropics of Cochabamba with his father and brother. He arrived in Sucre in search of greater opportunities in life so he could get ahead. 

In the tropical zone, he has been working in the field of agriculture on leased land for two years. He produces papaya that he takes care of with dedication in order to obtain a good harvest. He sells the produce onsite to fruit vendors. With the income generated from the production, he already bought his own land in the city, but he wants to continue growing financially, so he decided to expand the production of papaya, which is also easy to care for. 

That is why he needs a loan, to be able to buy papaya seedlings since he already has the land well prepared for planting. In this way, he will achieve his proposed objectives and will earn more income so he can take on other activities.

loans.use: To buy papaya seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two doors.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro es una señora de 62 años de edad, ella no recibio estudio, pues se dedico a trabajar en una cafetalera;  hace un año se separo de su esposo. Ella trabajo desde 1985 en una Cooperativa y ahora ya esta jubilada recibe una pension quincenal, su familia esta conformada por tres hijos todos ellos ya estan casados.

Ella tiene una pequeña tiendita desde hace ya varios años, ella vive sola; pero solo por las noches un nieto se queda con ella de 6:00 pm a 7:00 am.

El financiamiento sera utilizado para comprar arroz, frijoles, detergentes, pan, golocinas entre otros productos para su tienda y para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla de maiz y frijol para cultivar.

En el futuro ella desea tener mas surtida su tienda y de la cosecha de granos poder tener a la venta y de ahi obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Genaro is a 62 year-old woman. She never studied because she spent her time working on a coffee plantation. One year ago, she separated from her husband. Since 1985, she has worked in a co-op and now that she is retired, she gets a pension every two weeks. Her family is made up of three children, all of whom are now married. 

For several years now, she has had a small little store. She lives alone, but at night, one of her grandsons stays with her from 6:00 pm to 7:00 am.

The financing will be used to buy rice, beans, detergents, bread, candy and other products for her store and to buy fertilizers, seed corn and beans to plant. 

In the future, she would like to have her store better stocked, and be able to sell the grain harvest and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, detergents, bread, candy and other products for her store and to buy fertilizers and seed corn and beans to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a small business selling beverages such as soda and beer.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda was born in 1960. She is a very hardworking woman. She is a highly educated person. She has worked in a local school for more than 30 years. She is a teacher of the Russian language. She has a small salary, so she is going to organize a new business selling food items. With this aim, Mavluda took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She will manage the business alone. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy food items to organize her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items to organize a new business.

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
Irene, who is in her late 30s, is single with one son who goes to school. She has been running a business selling fabrics and bedsheets door to door for one and a half years now. She works from 9 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Irene's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more fabrics and material to make more bedsheets to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of renting a shop where she can sell her products in one place instead of moving door to door. She finds it difficult especially when it rains heavily and she can not do business.

Irene will share this loan with her loan group "Dubai" which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and material to make more bedsheets.

loans.name: Ronald Esau

texts.es:
Ronald, es natural de Piura, ciudad ubicada al norte del País, junto a su madre y hermana emigraron a la ciudad de Lima en busca de un mejor futuro para la familia. Su padre se quedó a trabajar en Piura para así apoyar desde allá a su familia. Su madre realiza trabajos eventuales para poder generar ingresos a su familia, pero la mayor parte del tiempo se encuentra en casa.
Ronald estudia actualmente Mecánica de la Producción, y está cursando el Segundo Ciclo de la Carrera, anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en un call center y también realizaba trabajos de Carpintería, pero debido a los horarios de la Carrera y de su Trabajo, tuvo que dejar de trabajar para poder continuar con sus estudios, es por eso que está buscando el apoyo de KIVA para poder culminar sus estudios sin ningún problema. 
Sin el apoyo de KIVA tendría que dejar sus estudios, ya que se dedicaría solo a trabajar para poder reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita completar sus estudios. 
Ronald agradece mucho el apoyo de apoyo que brinda KIVA a través de IPFE por medio del Crédito Educativo, ya que es una acción admirable porque le permite a jóvenes como él a cumplir sus sueños de ser un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Ronald, a native of Piura, a city located in the north of the homeland (Perú), emigrated with his mother and sister to the city of Lima looking for a better future for the family. His father stayed to work in Piura and support the family from there. His mother works temporary jobs to bring in income for the family, but most of the time remains at home.

Ronald presently studies mechanical production, and is studying the second cycle of the program. Previously he worked in a call center and also worked carpentry jobs, but due to the hours of his program and his work, he had to stop working to be able to continue with his studies. It is because of this that he is seeking the help of Kiva to be able to finish his studies without difficulty. 

Ronald is doing his technical degree with SENATI, one of Peru's premier technical degree programs. 95% of SENATI students find employment within their technical degree within 3 months of graduation. For this reason, and because of a promising labor market, Ronald feels this is a good investment in his future.

Without the support of Kiva he would need to abandon his studies, and dedicate himself solely to working to bring in sufficient money that would allow him to finish his studies.

Ronald greatly appreciates the support that Kiva provides though IPFE via Crédito Educativo; it is an admirable deed because it allows young adults such as him to realize their dreams of being an excellent professional.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his technical degree in Mechanical Production, so that he can work as a titled professional and support his family.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe and is working as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Melania has been running a salon at her home for the past year now. She specializes in braiding, plaiting and hair product sales.
With the Kiva loan, Melania will purchase rollers, a hair drier, braids and hair sprays. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own salon at the local business center to increase her business. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products

loans.name: Madelyn Vanessa

texts.es:
Madelyn de 21 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato, no siguió sus estudios universitarios por temor a la inseguridad al tener que viajar. Sus padre viajaron al extranjero por lo que solo vive con sus abuelos.

Es empleada, trabaja en una ferretería y tiene 2 años de experiencia en ventas. Viaja diariamente 15 kilómetros en autobús, desde las 8:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm. También tiene una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad y de venta de granos básicos de la que sus abuelos se encargan.

El préstamo será utilizado para usos personales, su abuelo está enfermo y se encuentra estrecha económicamente.

Espera mejorar su situación económica para cuidar bien a sus abuelos, trabajar muy duro para subir de puesto en el lugar donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Madelyn, 21 years old, is single and doesn't have children. She completed high school, and did not continue with university studies for fear of insecurity in traveling. Her parents traveled abroad, as such she lives alone with her grandparents.

She is employed, works at a hardware store, and has two years of sales experience. She travels 15 kilometers daily on the bus, working from 8am until 4pm. She also has a small primary goods and basic grains store for which her grandparents are responsible.

The loan will be used for personal uses; her grandfather is ill and experience financial difficulty.

She hopes to improve her financial situation to take good care of her grandparents; she works very hard to improve her position in her place of work.

loans.use: to cover the medical bills of her grandfather.

loans.name: Angel Javier

texts.es:
Angel es un joven soñador de 23 años, soltero, trabaja como Obrero de campo en su ciudad natal, Santiago.
El buen desempeño en el trabajo es el resultado de todo el esfuerzo que le pone a su labor y a los deseos de superación que tiene. Le encanta la música porque piensa que es la mejor forma en la cual las personas pueden expresar sus sentimientos, es por ello que está estudiando esta carrera y le está yendo bien.
Angel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pintarrajear las paredes de su vivienda para que su familia pueda vivir de manera más cómoda, así estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para convertirse en un gran músico.
texts.en:
Angel is a young dreamer, 23 and single, and works as a field worker in his hometown, Santiago.
His good work performance is the result of all the effort that he puts into his work and the desire to overcome that he has. He is fascinated by music because he believes that it is the best way in which people may express their feelings; because of this he is studying this career and it is going well.
Angel is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided he will be able to daub the walls of his house so that his family may live in a more comfortable manner. This way is will be improving his quality of life and will continue striving to make himself into a great musician.

loans.use: to daub the walls of his house.

loans.name: Adilaida

texts.en:
Adilaida grows bananas, work that she has done since she was very young. Her father taught her this work since it was the main source of income for the family. In addition to farming, her husband works as a hired hand in their neighborhood.

Adilaida is requesting this loan from GDMPC micro credit, since her existing banana farm needs replanting in order to regain a better harvest from their farm. She borrowed a new loan recently to purchase planting materials and manure fertilizer. In the future, she wants to renovate her house and be able to give her children the education she did not have. Shee is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase planting materials and manure fertilizer

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 44 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for three years. Right now her monthly income is KES 7,500.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, soap, detergent and cooking oil to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is Jacqueline's fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid back her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Gimena

texts.es:
Gimena es una joven soltera muy emprendedora de 22 años, con muchos sueños que espera cumplir más adelante y con la mayor motivación en su vida, su familia. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a su esfuerzo está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y trabaja como Asistente Contable en una gran empresa, ella cree que le va bien por su ardua labor, siempre acepta nuevos desafíos y es muy responsable.
Gimena está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de comedor para amoblar su casa, con esto mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia, podrán reunirse todos juntos para disfrutar de sus momentos libres y así seguirá esforzándose para terminar su profesión y tener mayores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Gimena is a young, single woman, very entrepreneurial, 22 years old, with many dreams to fulfill expectations, and the best motivation in her life, her family. Thanks to the support of her parents and her own efforts she is studying accounting and works as an assistant accountant in a large business. She believes it is going well because of her hard work; she always accepts new challenges and is very responsible.
Gimena is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided she will be able to buy a dining set to furnish her house; with this she will improve the quality of life of her family. They will be able to all get together to enjoy their free time, and she will continue striving to complete her studies and have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a dining set for her house.

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en: Esnath is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives in the Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe and works as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Esnath has been running a salon at her home for the past year now. She specializes in braiding, plaiting and hair product sales. With this Kiva loan, Esnath will purchase rollers, a hair dryer, braids and hair sprays. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own salon at the local business center to increase her business. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase rollers, a hair dryer, braids and hair sprays.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de celulares,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salira delante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de celulares.La socia solicita el credito para comprar celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This borrower continues selling mobile phones to earn a living.  With the goal of expanding her business, she is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia Rina se sigue dedicando a sus estudios en la univerdidad,la socia por medio de sus estudios quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender ropa.La socia solicita el crediuto para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina continues with her university studies so she can get ahead.  Her goal is to open a clothing shop.  She is requesting a loan to buy a television set for her home.

The borrower is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy a television set for her home.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,blusas y polos,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita continues with her clothing business, selling pants, blouses and polo shirts.  Through her business she wants to get ahead and is requesting a loan to buy polo shirts, blouses and pants.

The borrower is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy polo shirts, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Sally Leeset

texts.es:
La socia Sally Lesset se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de muevbles,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles.La socia solicita el credito para comprar muebles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sally Lesset will continue her work selling furniture as this business will allow her to move forward. Her dream is to expand her furniture business.

Sally has applied for a loan to buy furniture. She is happy about this loan and is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es:
Luis vive en Lima con sus padres y hermana en el Distrito Emergente de Independencia, su padre es un taxista independiente y es el único que trabaja en la familia, su madre se dedica solo a su casa. 
Luis es un estudiante muy aplicado en sus cursos, debido al horario le es muy difícil estudiar y trabajar para poder apoyar a su familia con los ingresos del hogar; es por tal motivo que para él es muy importante contar con el apoyo de KIVA para no dejar sus estudios y sus padres se sientan un poco más aliviados en cuanto a los gastos de él, ya que su hermana también es una estudiante muy aplicada y no puede dejar de estudiar.
Él eligió la Carrera de Mecatrónica Industrial por ser una profesión innovadora, que contribuye a la tecnología del país. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el Segundo Ciclo.
Luis considera que el trabajo que viene realizando KIVA es muy admirable ya que con este Crédito se benefician las personas que estudian y tienen deseos de superación personal y profesional, pero no cuentan con los recursos económicos para poder solventarse.
texts.en:
Luis lives in Lima with his parents and sister in the emerging district of Independencia. His father is an independent taxi driver, and he is the only one that works in the family. His mother is dedicated solely to work at home. 

Luis is a student who is very dedicated to his courses. He chose to study the field of Industrial Mechatronics (which is a multidisciplinary field of engineering, combining mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, telecommunications engineering, control engineering and computer engineering) because it is a very innovative profession that can contribute to the technology of his country. He is currently enrolled in his second cycle of classes. 

Luis is doing his technical degree with SENATI, one of Peru's premier technical degree programs. 95% of SENATI students find employment within their technical degree within 3 months of graduation. For this reason, and because of a promising labor market, Luis feels this is a good investment in his future.

Due to time constraints, it is very difficult for him to both study and work in order to help his family with household expenses. For this reason, it is very important for him to have the support of KIVA; he does not want to leave his studies, but wants his parents to feel better about his household expenses. His sister is also a dedicated student who does not want to stop studying. 

Luis believes that the work done by KIVA is very admirable, because the loans can benefit people who are studying and have dreams of personal and professional success, but do not have the economic resources to do so alone.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a technical degree in Industrial Mechatronics, so that he can become a titled professional and support his little sister's education

loans.name: Galatmo

texts.ru:
45-летняя Галатмо в течение 6 лет работает швеей. Она берет заказ на пошив женских платьев разных фасонов. Галатмо замужем. Она мать троих сыновей и одной дочери. Галатмо со своей семьей живет в сельском районе Рудаки.
Муж работает, дети учатся. Один сын Галатмо учится в Коммерческом Институте города Душанбе. Он студент третьего курса. Годовое обучение сына стоит 4600 TJS, что в долларах это будет $925. Галатмо к сожалению сейчас не имеет таких сбережений. Поэтому она запрашивает кредит в размере 1000 долларов США. Из этой суммы $925 пойдут на оплату контракта, а остальные $75 на учебные принадлежности сына. Галатмо очень нуждается в этом кредите. Она верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Galatmo is 45 years old, and she has been working as a seamstress for the past six years.  She receives orders and sews different styles of women's dresses.  She is married and the mother of four children (three boys and one girl).  Galatmo and her family live in a rural area of the Rudaki district.

Galatmo's husband works and the children are all studying.  One of her sons is a third-year student at a Commerce Institute located in Dushanbe.  His yearly tuition amounts to 4,600 TJS (the equivalent of 925 USD).  Unfortunately, Galatmo doesn't have that much money right now.  For this reason, she is taking a loan of 1,000 USD.  She will use 925 USD to pay for her son's tuition and the remaining 75 USD to pay for his school supplies.  This loan is very important to Galatmo, and she is really hoping to receive your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's higher education tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilisers and supplies for fighting disease and weeds.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es amplair el negocio de servicio de taxi.El socio solicita le credito para comprar llantas.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
José continues to work at his taxi business. He works from 8am until 7pm. His dream is to expand his business. José is applying for this loan in order to buy tyres.

José is grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy tyres.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche y gaseosas,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,huevos y aceite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa continues to work at her grocery store. She sells rice, sugar, milk and fizzy drinks. Through this business, Rosa wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. This borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, eggs and oil.

Rosa is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs and oil.

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.ru:
Мирослав женат. У него трое детей. Мирослав имеет работу и дополнительно занимается грузовыми перевозками на конях с возом.

Мирослав ранее брал кредиты. Последний кредит помог ему сделать косметический ремонт в комнатах дома.  Мирослав пережил много трудностей в жизни: его первая жена погибла по время родов, потом у него были проблемы с работой. Тем не менее, оптимистичнй настрой Мирослава помог ему справиться с трудностями в жизни и сторить большине планы на будущее. Мирослас с женой мечтают купить большой дом для своей семьи. 

Мирослав просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20 000 гривен на ремонт коридора и замену старых окон в доме. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en:
Miroslav is married and the father of three children.  In addition to his job, he also transports merchandise on a horse-driven cart.

This is not Miroslav's first loan.  Thanks to a previous loan he was able to redecorate the rooms in his house.  Miroslav has gone through a lot in life:  his first wife died in childbirth, then he had some work-related problems.  In spite of all this, his positive attitude allowed him to cope with his many difficulties and to make big plans for the future.  He and his wife are dreaming of buying a big house for the family.

Miroslav is asking for a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to perform some repairs in his hallway and to replace some old windows.  Thanks to this loan, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to change some windows and perform some repairs in his hallway.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn 01 Quảng Bình Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Hạnh is 30 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn 01 Quảng Bình solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Мастура в первую очередь хочет выразить свою благодарность кредиторам KIVA за их финансовую поддержку. Благодаря им она успешно прододолжила свой животноводческий бизнес и теперь вновь обратилась за повторным кредитом для развития своего малого бизнеса. На всю сумму кредита Мастура хочет купить несколько голов овец и баранов, чтобы увеличить их поголовье. 
Мастура успешно совмещает свой бизнес со своей работой. Она одновременно работает в суде района делопроизводителем. Она ответственный и добропорядочный человек. Мастура обещает и этот кредит выплачивать в срок. Она снова нуждается в Вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
First and foremost, Mastura wants to express her gratitude to the Kiva lenders who have already supported her financially.  Thanks to them, she was able to successfully carry on her animal husbandry business.  She is now requesting a new loan to further develop the same business.  She will use the entire amount of her loan to buy a few head of sheep and rams, which will allow her to increase her livestock headcount.

Mastura is employed as a district court clerk and she is able to combine her two professional activities very well.  She is also a responsible and respectable woman.  She needs your support again and promises to repay this new loan on time.

loans.use: to increase her livestock headcount and develop her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is a 64-year-old widow with eight children. She earns a living through farming and sometimes she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 19 years and the current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

Sok is a second cycle client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business. She is now leading her group to seek another loan. As the leader, Sok wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Она очень трудолюбивая и честная девушка. Мать Шахнозы имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе учителем. Ее отец занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Она живет вместе с родителями счастливо. Шахноза с детства мечтала поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. В прошлом году благодаря своим стараниям и поддержки родителей поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Она учится на 2 курсе в экономическом факультете. Шахноза запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора 2 курса. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Shahnoza was born and raised in a rural area of Tajikistan.  She is a very hardworking and honest young woman.  Her mother has a degree in education and works as a secondary school teacher.  Her father works as a taxi driver.  Shahnoza still lives with her parents and is very happy.

Ever since she was a child, Shahnoza has always dreamed of attending university in order to get a higher education.  Last year, thanks to her hard work and her parents' support, she was able to enroll at the Khujand State University.  She is now a second-year student and she takes courses from the Department of Economics.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her second year's tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her second year's tuition at the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat, engine and new fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Emitiot Interest Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Irene, a member of Emitiot Interest Self Help Group. She is forty five years old and married with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 where she went through training on enterprise creation and financial management. This enriched her business management skills.

Irene runs a kiosk where she sells potatoes and grains such as maize and beans. She is borrowing a loan to expand her kiosk by adding more stocks of beans and maize. This will help her put up with the rising demand for her commodities. Irene believes that the business will flourish and bring her more income. This will enable her to meet her family needs such as education, food and clothing without much struggle.

 She is very grateful to Kiva for the financial support and she promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more stock consisting of maize and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory such as clothing, footwear, and cosmetics

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura es natural de Ayacucho, ciudad que forma parte de la Sierra Peruana. Ella tuvo que emigrar de su lugar de origen en busca de un mejor futuro en Lima, sus padres se dedican al trabajo de campo en Ayacucho, ella tiene 4 hermanos. Actualmente vive con sus tíos, quienes la estuvieron apoyando durante el primer ciclo de estudios, el segundo ciclo les fue difícil solventarlo por lo elevado de la pensión mensual. Lamentablemente, tuvo que dejar sus estudios durante 7 meses por falta de dinero.
Actualmente se encuentra cursando el Segundo Ciclo de la carrera de Diseño Gráfico;  debido al horario y a los cursos que está llevando se le dificulta trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, por lo que le es muy importante contar con el apoyo de KIVA para no dejar sus estudios.
Ella es una joven muy emprendedora, feliz con la carrera que está estudiando ya que la beneficiará económicamente y le permitirá apoyar a su familia en Ayacucho, quienes se sentirán orgullosos de que ella pudo lograr sus objetivos a pesar de los obstáculos presentados durante todo el camino.
Ella cree que la educación es la herramienta básica para poder desarrollarse, por lo que considera la tarea de los asociados de KIVA como muy loable y digna de ser imitada.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a native of Ayacucho, a city which is part of the Peruvian highlands. She had to move from her place of origin in the search of a better future in Lima, her parents work in the fields in Ayacucho, she has 4 siblings. She currently lives with her aunt and uncle, who have been supporting her during her first course of study, the second course was difficult for them to afford her monthly lodgings. Unfortunately, she had to abandon her studies for seven months due to a lack of money.

At present she is studying the second course of a degree in Graphic Design, due to her timetable and the courses she is taking it is difficult for her to work and study at the same time, so it is very important that she can count on the support of KIVA so she doesn't leave her studies. She is a very entrepreneurial young person, happy with the degree she is studying as she will benefit financially and it will enable her to support her family in Ayacucho, who will feel proud of her - that she can reach her objectives despite the obstacles she comes across on the way. She believes that education is the tool to be able to grow, so she considers the job of KIVA partners as commendable and worthy of imitation.

loans.use: to cover living costs while studying.

loans.name: Nyakanyinya Group

texts.en: Keresi is a long-standing client aged 31 years and a member of Nyakanyinya Group. He is married with 5 children aged 13, 11, 9, 7 and 5 years; 4 children attend school at the moment. He does local brew trading and coffee farming to supplement his income. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings) so that he can buy a variety of the local brew such that he can attract more customers which will boost his business. He started local brew trading in the year 2011 to earn income to support him and his family. He is a hard working man who works 6 hours a day. He does his businesses from a rural area of Nyakanyinya in Mitooma. His customers are bars in Rukungiri and Ishaka townb which sell the local brew. His future plan is to be financially stable and educate all his children. He is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations, poor transport and debtors but hopes to grow and boost his businesses through his hard work. He would like to tell UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI) to continue the good work they are doing.

loans.use: To buy locally processed brew

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis le 26 12 2011 est composé de femmes issues de même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
La responsable madame Arame âgée de 56 est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont quatre garçons et quatre filles.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de poissons depuis bientôt dix et capitalise beaucoup d’expérience. Son nouveau crédit 340000 lui permettra de se payer 200000 francs de poissons frais et le reste des produits halieutiques pour les revendre au détails au niveau du petit marché de leur quartier.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group was set up on 26th December 2011 and is made up of women from the same neighborhood, who have joined forces through good social and professional relationships. The person responsible for the group is Arame, who is 56 years old, married and mother to eight children: four boys and four girls. She has been buying and selling fish for almost ten years now and has built up a significant experience. Her new loan of 340,000FCFA will enable her to pay for 200,000FCFA worth of fresh fish and she will use the rest to buy fish products to resell on a retail basis at the small market in her neighborhood. The profits she makes from her business enables her to provide for her family's food and build up her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh fish for resale on a retail basis.

loans.name: Brenda Leticia

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 31 años de edad casada originaria del departamento de Sololá tiene tres hijos el primero casado y tiene ya su familia, el segundo y tercero estudian en la comunidad donde viven, ella realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad ella es una mujer emprendedora y que dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que ella dignamente a desempeñado durante ocho años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que Brenda le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para compra de terreno que le están ofreciendo en su comunidad para dejar un bonito  recuerdo para sus hijos y así mejorar el futuro para sus hijos y que tengan ellos con que desarrollarse en un futuro.

Los sueños de ella es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y es por eso que quiere compra dos molinos de nixtamal instalarlas en su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Life gave Brenda an opportunity to work as an employee in a shop selling everyday groceries. This is what she was hoping for, not just an open door but also what was behind the door. And she found something which defined what she wanted to be. 

She is 31 years old, is married and comes from the department of Sololá. She has three children. The oldest is married and has a family already, while the other two go to school in the community where they live. She puts in an impressive amount of effort. In spite of her age, she is an enterprising woman and says it is never too late to begin to develop and to have a vision for the future.

The work she has been doing in a dignified way over the last eight years is buying and selling groceries in her community. This is how she manages to have an income for the family and a profit to improve her living conditions. 

Brenda will use the loan requested to buy land which is for sale in her community, so she can leave a nice memento for her children and so improve their future. This will give them a way to develop in the future.

Her dreams are for her family's living conditions to be suitable in the future and so she wants to buy two corn mills to install in her community. She also hopes to see her sons have a life as professionals.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.fr: Marié et père de 02 enfants de 07 et 05ans tous scolarisés, Mr Kossigan âgé de 34ans pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille revend des CD dans sa boutique depuis 2002. Il est à son second crédit à WAGES et ce prêt l'aidera à acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. A l'avenir, il souhaite subvenir aux besoins des membres de la famille et augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Kossigan, who is 34 years old, is married and father to two children, aged seven and five years old, both of whom go to school. In order to provide for his family's needs, he has been selling CDs in his shop since 2002. He is on his second loan from WAGES, and this loan will help him to buy more stock so that he can meet customer demand. In the future he would like to be able to provide for his family's needs and increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy CDs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture to furnish his house.

loans.name: Steramaris

texts.en:
Steramaris has a retail shop which she has been running for 20 years now. She is 56 years old, married and blessed with 4 children who are all grown up. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family.

She will use this loan to buy sugar, flour, rice, bottled water and cooking oil to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide  for the needs of her family.

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid all her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: At

texts.en:
At is 43 years old, a married woman with four children. She fattens piglets to resell. Her husband is 45, an alcohol producer. Three of her children are students and one is a garment-factory worker. They all live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $17 a day. 

Now At would like to request a loan to buy piglets to fatten and resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to expand piglet fattening, fill the soil around her house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is a 30-year-old married man with two children. Mahammad is an internally displaced person, and he lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. 

He is a very skilled farmer with experience in a variety of agricultural areas. He has an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind. He has a corn field that he tends every day from very early in the morning. 

Lack of water is a big problem in his region. This is why people in the area can't water their gardens and fields and their crops die. He is asking for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to be able to supply water for his garden every month. Please support  Mahammad.

loans.use: to supply water for his garden every month.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
Ceferino de 63 años d edad,  debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos y que los padres preferían que sus hijos trabajaran y aportaran a la casa no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado desde los 23 años, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, han procreado 4 hijos y todos estudian. Con él viven su esposa y sus hijos.

Ceferino toda su vida se dedicó a la agricultura y ganadería, trabajó desde muy pequeño con su padre para aprender lo que hoy sabe. Tiene un sistema de riego que le facilita el mantenimiento de los cultivos en temporadas de sequía, ordeña dos vacas que le proporcionan suficiente leche como procesarla y después consumir o vender. Todo esto lo realiza con la ayuda de sus dos hijos varones, quienes le ayudan durante la mañana y estudian en la tarde.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una ternera para crianza, espera con el tiempo de leche y aumentar la producción y a la vez los ingresos para la familia.

Espera tener mayor cantidad de ganado, trabajarlo y darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudio que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Ceferino, 63, didn't have the opportunity to go to school since his family had few resources and his parents preferred that their children work and support the home. He has been married since he was 23. His wife is dedicated to housework. They have four children and they are all in school. With him live his wife and children.

Ceferino has been dedicated to farming and raising animals his whole life. He worked since he was very small with his father to learn what he knows today. He has an irrigation system that facilitates the maintenance of his crops during dry seasons. He milks two cows that produce enough milk to process and later consume or sell. He does all of this work with the help of his two sons who help him in the mornings and go to school in the afternoons.

The loan will be used to buy a calf to raise. He hopes with time he can increase his milk production and, at the same time, the income for his family.

He hopes to have a greater quantity of cattle and to work and give his children the opportunity to study, which he did not have.

loans.use: to buy a calf to rear.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean continues to grow her business. She is now 35 years old and lives in rented house with her nine-year-old son. This is Jean’s second Kiva loan. 

Jean got her first loan in July 2013. She used the loan to increase her working capital. Increasing her working capital enabled her to serve customers who needed to send and receive large amounts of monies from her trading booth. Today, Jean is able to serve more customers on a daily basis. She successfully repaid her first loan. Jean’s ability to help her customers has gained her a lot of trust from people in her community. 

Jean is requesting her second loan so that she can open two more outlets. She will use the money to purchase two small trading booths. The trading booths will be placed in the small town in Southern Province called Kalomo at places called Liyubu and Mingongo. Jean is excited to take the mobile money service to these compounds.

Jean would like to take this opportunity to thank her lenders for their continued support. She uses the profits from her business to pay her rentals and pay for her son’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two trading booths so that she can open two more outlets

loans.name: Rasad

texts.en:
Rasad is a 29-year-old married man with two children. Rasad is an internally displaced person, and he lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. 

Rasad is asking for a loan of 1,200 AZN  in order to continue cultivating corn, which he has been selling for some time now. He does this for the benefit of his family and for his community. When he did not have access to loans, Rasad was not producing a good harvest. However, thanks to the loans that he has been getting from AQROINVEST CU, he has had a great harvest and better production, and he has used his corn cultivation for the benefit of his community and family as a source of income.

The investment that he will be making with the new loan is the purchase of fertilizers, which are very important for the production of corn, and for a good harvest for his family and community. Please support him.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Neris Yolanda

texts.es:
Neris de 45 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijas de 16 años de edad, 18 años de edad, 23 años de edad y 30 años de edad; las dos mayores estudian en la universidad y las dos menores en bachillerato. Con ella viven su esposo y sus 4 hijas.

Neris tiene 15 años trabajando con el ministerio de salud, es enfermera, desde pequeña le gusto siempre ayudar a los demás. Todos los días viaja en autobús o en su vehículo 10 kilómetros para llegar al lugar de trabajo, no tiene un horario específico ya que a veces hace turno de noche y otras veces de día. 

El préstamo será utilizado para reparar el vehículo, al ser su 2° medio de transporte es necesario que este en buenas condiciones, ya está en el taller y la reparación tiene un costo elevado.

Neris espera que a pesar de las dificultades, sus hijas terminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Neris, 45 years old, is married and has four daughters who are 16, 18, 23, and 30 years old. The two eldest study at university and the two youngest in high school. With her live her husband and four daughters.

Neris has 15 years experience working with the health ministry. She is a nurse. Since she was young, she always liked to help others. Every day she travels ten kilometers on a bus or in her own vehicle to get to the place where she works. She does not have a specific schedule since sometimes she works a night shift and other times during the day.

The loan will be used to repair her vehicle. Since it is her secondary mode of transportation, it is necessary to be in good condition. It is already in the shop and the repair cost is high.

Neris hopes that, despite the difficulties, her daughters will complete university courses.

loans.use: to pay to repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 56-year-old widow from the town of Carles, Iloilo. 

She is engaged in selling dried and salted fish to the people in her place. Judith has been doing this business for more than 15 years now.
 
Judith is requesting a loan to buy more fish and salt. With this, she will be able to make more dried and salted fish, which she can then sell to the market. Judith has been a member of CEVI for more than four years now.
 
Judith hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more salt and fish.

loans.name: Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is John. He is a member of Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group. He is 47 years old, married and a father of seven children.

John practices maize, beans and vegetable farming. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he commercialized his farming and now he is able to get more profits out of farming. 

He is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and quality fertilizer. This will enable him to increase the crop yield and be able meet the rising demand for maize and beans. This will improve his income, putting him in a position to educate his children. 

He is grateful and happy for Kiva and its lenders for the support and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid planting seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia, ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para salir adelante.

Ella se gana la vida con un negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como almuerzos y comidas en el municipio de La Dorada. 

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y mejorar su servicio, por esta razón solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de sillas y mesas, además de comprar insumos para sus preparaciones.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda y buen corazón de las personas para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en: Martha is a woman of experience, wisdom and much patience. She has worked practically all of her life to get ahead. She earns a living with a business preparing and selling food like lunches and dinners in the town of La Dorada. She works every day from 5AM to 3PM in order to have her product ready and fresh for her customers that, for the most part, are neighbors from the area where she lives. She wishes to capitalize her business and improve her service. For this reason, she is requesting economic help to buy chairs and tables as well as ingredients for her dishes. One of her main difficulties is the lack of money to invest in her business but she trusts in the help and good hearts of the people to get her business ahead.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables as well as buy ingredients for her dishes in order to be able to improve her work.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is divorced. She is 40 years. Fotima is a careful mother for her child. She has one non-adult child. 

She began her own business of selling clothes one year ago. Fotima sells men's, women's and children's clothes. She has a store in a local market. Fotima little by little develops her business. 

She is going to buy clothes for the new autumn season but she has not enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy clothes for the new season. She is going to improve living conditions for her child from the profit. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 35-year-old single woman who is taking care of three children.

She has been operating a clothing sales shop for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Jennifer is now servicing her second loan of KES 36,000 and intends to use this amount to buy satin, cotton and silk materials to add to her current stock, which seems to be running out.

Jennifer plans to use the anticipated income to open another clothing sales shop in a nearby town and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy satin, cotton and silk materials to add to her current stock, which is running out.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa is married and has three children. She earns a good income from her piggery and has repaid successfully her previous loan used to buy feed. She took out a new loan recently to buy feeding supplies and an additional piglet. She is determined to expand her business in order to provide a better life for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and an additional piglet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and good quality seeds to plan and to assist her potato crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and purchase educational equipment for her second child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a steamer, braids, weaves, relaxers, treatments, and oils. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to buy better hair dryers, rollers, and seats for her salon. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy a steamer, braids, weaves, and oils

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia Agripina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,blusas y polos,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,blusas y pantalones. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Agripina, continues to be dedicated to her business selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses and polos. Through this business, she wishes to get ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy polos, blouses and pants.

She is happy about this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy polos, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows and goats to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is aged 43, married  to a motorcycle driver, and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 13 years, and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to  purchase canned goods, detergent bars, shampoo, toothpaste, beverages, and vinegar to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and expand so that she able to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, detergent bars, shampoo, toothpaste, beverages, and vinegar

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
