This is Liza, 55, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is a single mother with four children. Her eldest is in high school and the other three are out of school. She manages her own household while operating the business.  Liza works doubly hard to provide for her and the children's daily personal and household needs.
 
Liza operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Aside from this, she also sells souvenir products during the summer season.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, sacks of rice, charcoal and vegetables to expand her product inventory.  This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Liza aims to grow her business and to be able to send all her children to school.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 31 years old and had two children. He did not have the financial resources to finish school. He is married and his wife works selling grocery goods in their village, which helps him with the household expenses. 

Ariel runs a transportation service in their community to support his family. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy a motor sidecar and additional grocery goods for his wife's retail store. In the future, he wants to give his family a better future. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy a motor sidecar and additional grocery goods for his wife's retail store

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
María nació en Latacunga, perteneciente a la parroquia La Matriz, perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi de la República del Ecuador tiene 31 años de edad, está casada con Edgaar de 28 años, tiene cinco hijos , los mismos que viven con ellos, actualmente tienen su casa propia en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia Ignacio Flores , sector muy reconocido por ser una zona agrícola y lechera, el barrio se llama Jilingua Grande, viven ahí desde hace 10 años, ya que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo lograron construirla.
Por la falta de recursos económico en un inicio María tuvo que buscar la manera de solventar y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos, es por esto que se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores.
Maria ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  con el esfuerzo y sacrifico de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria, ya que desde que terminó el colegio tubo que trabajar.
María tuvo muchos obstáculos en su vida y en su matrimonio pero  con la ayuda de sus hijos y de sus padres salieron adelante.
Por el momento solicita un crédito para invertir en la construcción de otra casita la misma que está en un lugar as cercano a la ciudad.
Hoy María quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
María was born in Latacunga, which is part of the La Matriz parish, in Cotopaxi province in the Republic of Ecuador. She is 31 years old, married to Edgaar who is 28 years old, and has five children, who live with them. Currently, they live in their own house in the city of Latacunga, in Ignacio Flores parish, a sector well known as being an agricultural and dairy zone, in the neighborhood called Jilingua Grande. They have lived there for 10 years, since with great sacrifices and effort they managed to build it. 

Due to lack of economic resources, María had to look for a way to pay some bills and help her husband with the expenses. For this reason, she works raising and selling small animals.

María has shown herself to be a determined and enterprising woman; with her parents' efforts and sacrifices, she was able to finish secondary school, and from entering secondary school, she had to work.  

María had many challenges in her life and in her marriage, but with the help of her children and her parents, they have gotten ahead.

At the moment, she asks for a loan to invest in building another house, which is in a location closer to the city.

Today, María wishes to extend her sincere thanks and best wishes to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making the growth in her work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to invest in constructing a house.

loans.name: Máxima Margarita

texts.es:
Máxima de  32 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, la falta de apoyo económico le obligo a no poder continuar su formación académica, es madre soltera de un niño de 6 años de edad que ya asiste a la escuela. Vive con su mamá y hermanos, solo su hijo depende de ella.

Máxima es comerciante, tiene un año de experiencia en la venta informal, tiene un puesto en el mercado en el que vende ropa usada. Inicio con la ayuda de su madre, ella le compraba la ropa y Máxima se encargaba de venderla. Hoy en día todavía la apoya en la compra, pero lo demás lo hace ella solo, diariamente viaja 50 kilómetros en autobús para llegar a su puesto en el mercado y trabaja de 7:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm

El préstamo será utilizado para compra ropa, ha tenido gastos médicos con su madre y se quedó sin capital suficiente, la ropa usada la venden en maletas y viene variada por lo que no sabe con exactitud que prendas le saldrán. 


Máxima espera dar a su hijo el estudio hasta una carrera universitaria y apoyar a su madre en lo que pueda así como ella la a apoyo siempre cuando más la necesito.
texts.en:
Máxima, 32 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. The lack of economic support meant she could not continue with her education. She is a single mother of a 6-year-old boy who is a student. She lives with her mother and siblings, and only her son is dependent on her.

Máxima is a businessperson, she has one year of experience in informal sales. She has a stand in the market where she sells used clothing. She began with the help of her mother, who bought the clothing and Máxima was in charge of selling it. Today, she stills helps her purchase the clothing, but everything else she does alone.  She travels 50 kilometers daily by bus to get to her market stand, and works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm. 

The loan will be used to purchase clothing, as she has had medical expenses with her mother and is left without sufficient capital. The used clothing is sold in bundles and they come as an assortment, so she doesn't know exactly what articles of clothing she will get. 

Máxima hopes to give her son education through a university degree and to support her mother as much as she can, as her mother has always supported her when she most needed it.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза вместе с родителями живет в отдаленном регионе. Она родилась в 1996 году. Шахноза живет в большой семье. Их 4 человек в семье. Ее отец врач. Он работает в поликлинике их кишлака. Так как его зарплата маленькая он ездит каждый год на несколько месяцев в Россию на заработки. Итак, Шахноза и ее семья живут бедно. Она в этом году поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Шахноза хочет после окончания университета работать учителем в той же школе, где она сама училась. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора в университете. Это ее первый год в университете и она надеется, что она будет учиться хорошо.
texts.en: Shahnoza lives with her parents in a remote region of Tajikistan. She was born in 1996, and her family consists of four people.  Her father, a doctor, works at the local clinic, but he has to spend a few months in Russia every year to bring some money home, as his income is very small.  Shahnoza and her family are quite poor.  This year, Shahnoza enrolled at the Khujand State University.  After she completes her studies, she would like to work as a teacher at the school where she used to go when she was younger.  Shahnoza is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition.  She is a first-year student, and she hopes to do well in her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda se sigue deducando al negocio de elaboracion de pan y venta de productos de belleza,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender pan.La socia soliciya el credito para comprar harina,azucar y leche para preparar pan.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Hilda, continues to be dedicated to her business making bread and selling beauty products. She already has many years experience with this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell bread. She is requesting the loan to buy flour, sugar and milk to make bread.

She is happy about the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and milk to make bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of madora (dried caterpillars), kapenta (dried sardines) and dried soya mince.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 58 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with five children. He has a photo studio and has been running it for 30 years now. He also supports seven members of his family. 

He will be using this loan to buy more picture frames in several sizes, colored printer inks for printing the photos, and camera film. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to grow his business by opening another photo studio and also hopes to live a happy life together with his family.

loans.use: To buy picture frames, films and printer ink.

loans.name: Mark Joseph

texts.en:
Mark Joseph is a fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of two young children. Mark Joseph has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. 

At present, Mark Joseph needs a loan for the business. He is asking for a loan to buy a new boat and fishing nets. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business, augmenting his catch and income. In the future, Mark Joseph has hopes of expanding his business and making it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Learnmore

texts.en:
Learnmore is twenty-three years old. She lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She is single and currently working as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to local secondary school students. In addition, Learnmore rents a table at the local flea market where she has been selling clothes and shoes for eight months now.

With the Kiva Loan, she intends to buy more items to sell at her shop. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family. She wishes to expand her business and open a shop if she gets the Kiva loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy school materials for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges, pineapples, watermelons and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 36-year-old woman, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to an ultra-poor family; she has been feeding her children using a very low income. There is only one earning person who has been contributing to the household expenses. Her husband has been learning to drive a rickshaw from his father.

Razia has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but mostly the savings are spent on household expenses. Now he wants to buy a new auto-rickshaw but does not have enough cash in hand to buy an auto-rickshaw. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  She hopes that her husband will drive the auto-rickshaw with his full devotion and will earn sufficient income.

Razia thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oven for her mother.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition for her son

loans.name: Jhony Manuel

texts.es:
Jhony Manuel tiene 48 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, domiciliado en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jhony Manuel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales y a la jornaleria, hace 20 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo: compra de cuyes, patos, cerdos; el préstamo le ayudará a incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jhony Manuel is 48 years old and is in a relationship with no children under his care. He lives in his own house in a rural part of the district of Oyotun, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru.

Jhony Manuel has worked raising and selling animals and as a day laborer for 20 years. His business is located at his house. He is requesting a loan for working capital buying guinea pigs, ducks and pigs. The loan will help him expand his business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, ducks and pigs.

loans.name: Diana Rose

texts.en:
Diana Rose is an 18-year-old college student from San Jose Del Monte, Bulacan, in the Philippines.  She is enrolled in a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration program at Access Computer and Technical Colleges and she anticipates finishing her degree in 2016.  Her parents work hard to provide for their everyday needs, especially for their education, but their earnings are not enough to sustain their financial expenses.  

Being the eldest and only girl in their family, Diana Rose desires a right-fit job right after her graduation so that she can help her parents and support her siblings in the future.  She prioritizes her studies and she endeavors to achieve all her dreams and goals in life together with her family.  She looks forward to this financial assistance with a grateful heart, from lenders who want to join her journey of discovering and conquering success.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a married woman and a mother of four children, they live in the town of Carles, Iloilo, in the Philippines.  For more than 25 years, Olivia has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband. 
 
Olivia is requesting a loan to buy an engine and fishing net, allowing them to improve their catch that they can sell to the market.  In the future, Olivia dreams of expanding their fishing business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy an engine and fishing net.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, who all go to school. She lives in her own house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Aisha operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, flour and beans. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to buy a bigger fridge to increase sales in soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beans, flour, and soap for her shop

loans.name: Jessan Marie

texts.en: Jessan Marie is a single mom who lives with her parents. She helps to earn money with her fishing business. She had a fishing boat and had it for rent. She sells fish in their villages and she was able to support the needs of her child. She had this fishing boat for over two years. She joined GDMPC  recently and had borrowed a new loan to buy new fishing nets. Hoping to improve the general living in the future, Jessan Marie works with her business with more determination.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees for her fourth child

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a kind woman and very hardworking.  She and her husband are farmers and have 4 children, she has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much.

Sanavbar has been farming for 20 years, producing potatoes and maize, and raising cows.  She has been in this line of work since she was young, so all of her experience has been dedicated to producing crops.  In order to provide her crops with the needed attention, Sanavbar is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 12,000 TJS so that she can buy fertilizer and seeds, to continue improving her crop production.  She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su hermana mayor, en el caserío Mochica, en el distrito de Sallique; su caserío es mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, y su población se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el cultivo de lima y el café los de mayor producción, así como al comercio; dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Jaime se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con una finca de lima frutera en muy buen estado, él produce su lima para venderlas en el caserío de Piqueada, además cultiva café y pan llevar, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, muy buenas referencias laborales y personales, cuenta con solvencia moral y económica. El destino del crédito es para invertirlo en su negocio, comprando abonos y fertilizantes para segurar una buena cosecha y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 23 year old single man who lives with his older sister in the village of Mochica in Sallique District. His community is medium sized with aspirations of growing. The people work in agriculture, with limes and coffee being the main products and work in commerce. It is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru.

Jaime works in agriculture on his farm, which is in very good condition, growing limes. He sells his limes in the village of Piqueada and also grows coffee and basic food items. He has more than 5 year experience doing this. He has very good personal and work references and moral and economic reliability. the loan will be used to buy fertilizer and manure to assure a good harvest and an acceptable profit so he can improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Listening to Richard referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one would mistake him for an Agricultural Extension Officer. Richard, from Siongiroi, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer of his locality. He has a wife and six children and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops and personal business, and he has been practicing farming for the past 15 years. Having done farming for such a long time he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. 

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Maasai tribe (Richard's tribe) - where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high and Richard wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Richard has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. 

Richard always says that, “to become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.” He has planted so many trees on his farm and dairy food will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. 

Through the loan, Richard will not only benefit from milk but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. Richard has been facing challenges in accessing finances but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Richard chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Richard underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and during the training season, he learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. 

Through accumulated profits Richard plans to permanently improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. He plans that through increased income he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a bundle of clothing

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children of whom four go to school. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Safina sells fish at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last ten years working seven days a week. 

Safina has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 700,000 (UGX) from MCDT- SACCO to buy fresh fish. Her major business challenge includes the perishability of fish. Her goal is to by a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Heza Group

texts.fr:
Didace  fait partie du groupe  Heza et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 34 ans et est marié à Odette ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 8 ans,dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  lits,tables,chaises,... depuis  12 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de planches pour fabriquer des chaises, des tables et des lits,... à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle ,et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Didace is a member of the Heza group and lives in Bubanza. He is 34 years old and is married to Odette, a farmer. Together they have four children, who are between one and eight years old. One of the children goes to school.

Didace has been selling beds, tables, chairs for twelve years. This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy many planks of wood that he will use to make chairs, tables, beds, etc. He will then sell this furniture to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a piece of land and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy planks of wood

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Ketaki, a small businesswoman, age 47, is the leader of a group that hails from Malipada, Bhawanipatna branch of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. Her family is comprised of her husband and herself. The member sitting in middle of the first row with a raised hand is Ketaki. 

Ketaki is managing a small grocery shop and sells daily need items like rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatos, onions, garlic, and zinger, etc. Her husband helps her replenish grocery items by going to nearby markets selling grocery items. At present, her monthly income is 5,500 Indian rupees, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. So she, along with ten members, decided to form a group to avail a loan to improve their businesses. From the present loan, Ketaki will purchase a huge amount of grocery items. She wishes to have a permanent stall of her own and increase grocery items in her shop.

The other ten members of her group are Aswini, Hemalata, Jharana, Surabhi, Khudralata,Sasmita, Sanjukta, Satyabati, Kalpana and Gitanjali. They are doing separate businesses in their locality.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks to sell

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.ru: Хакимчон выходец из города Душанбе. Ему 42 года. Он военный в отставке. В течение 20 лет он работал военным. После выхода на пенсию, Хакимчон стал заниматься перевозкой пассажиров, так как его жена нигде на работает и он должен кормить семью, а маленькая сумма пенсии не хватает на месячные семейные расходы. Так Хакимчон стал предоставлять услуги маршрутного такси и занимается этой  деятельностью уже последние 5 лет. У Хакимчона единственная дочь. Она сейчас студентка и поступила в этом году в Таджикский Национальный Университет на экономический факультет. Годовой контракт за учебу дочери в университете составляет 900 долларов США. Хакимчон просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов США, из которых 900 долларов пойдут на оплату контракта, а 100 долларов на учебные принадлежности. Хакимчон нуждается в данном кредите, так как не имеет собственных средств. Он ждет вашей отзывчивости.
texts.en: Hakimjon is 42 and lives in Dushanbe. He is a retired soldier and was in the military for 20 years. After retirement he started providing transportation services because his wife does not work and his small pension is not enough to feed his family. So Hakimjon became a taxi driver and has been for the last five years. Hakimjon has one daughter, who is a student and entered the Tajik National University this year in the economics department. Her tuition costs $900 per year, so Hakimjon is asking for a loan of $1000: $900 for the tuition, and $100 for school supplies. He needs the loan because he does not have enough money himself. He awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's college tuition

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
34-year-old Cecilia is a successful entrepreneur who has been operating  her own Zoona mobile money transfer business  in Lusaka, Zambia since last year. 

Currently, Cecilia employs four other people to work in the day-to-day operations of her business. She hopes to employ more people in future as her business grows. Cecilia takes pride in her Zoona business and strives to create an atmosphere that is welcoming to her customers and keep them coming back. She enjoys the opportunity that comes with being responsible for the success of her business, With Zoona’s platform, Cecilia says her business has the competitive advantage of being cheap, fast and easier to use compared to her competitors.

Cecilia is grateful to all her Kiva lenders for the financial support. She has been able to expand her business with the Kiva loans by opening up  four Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. This has increased her profit and turnover and made sure she remains capable of providing for her growing family.

Cecilia is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth. This will help her save on rental costs.

loans.use: To purchase a new trading booth to expand her mobile money business and serve more customers in need of sending or receiving money.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 59-year-old married woman and has six grown-up children in Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now. This has been the source of their daily income.

Nida is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and lead weights. With this, they will be able to improve their catch which allows them to sell more fish at the market. Nida wants to expand their fishing venture in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to help her coffee crops in this new season

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis.  She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. 

Josephine has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to build permanent business premises to work from home. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Houefa

texts.fr: Âgée de 35ans, madame Houefa se bat chaque fois pour apporter son aide à son conjoint afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Pour cela, elle revend des produits d'alimentation générale (eau , boisson, boite de conserve....). Avec une ancienneté de 11ans, elle a de nombreux clients qu'elle désire satisfaire c'est pour cela, elle fait son premier crédit pour s'acheter des marchandises. Houefa désire devenir grossiste et participer plus à l'épanouissement de ses enfants. Elle est mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés.
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Houefa works hard each day to support her husband in order to take care of the family's needs. She is a mother and has four children, of whom three go to school.

To do this, she works selling general food products (water, drinks, canned goods, etc.). With an experience of 11 years, she now has a number of customers who she wishes to serve. It is for this reason that she is seeking her first loan so that she can buy merchandise.

Houefa wishes to become a wholesaler and to contribute more to her children's development.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia lives in Kampala, Uganda.She is married with four children and all go to school. 

She sells second hand clothes at the market on retail basis. She has been in business for the last ten years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX (Ugandan shillings) 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: T o buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and purchase educational equipment for his son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying chemicals and feed for chicks .

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is living in Misamis Occidental, Philippines with her family. She is 49 and has four children. For over ten years, she has been running a general store and after all these years, the business is still doing well. She has to buy additional goods in order to offer more to her loyal customers. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She is determined that with the help of this loan, her business will prosper and it will help to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua is 51 years old,married, and, together with her spouse, blessed with two children. She has a maize mill business in Tala town and has been in this business for seven years now.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of maize for use in her business. This will enable her to sell and supply more maize flour. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to be successful in her business and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 49-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children attending school. Her husband is a plumber and he is the main income source of the family. 

Back to Ghada, she got involved in the agricultural field in 2011. She owns a small plot of land where she performs the crop growing processes. With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase agricultural supplies with the aim of increasing her production and consequently her income.

As for her future plans, Ghada looks forward to borrowing additional Kiva loans to continue improving her business ceaselessly.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to till and clean her field so she can begin planting.

loans.name: Zaalicah

texts.en:
Zaalicah is thankful that she was granted an 11,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase quantities of souvenir T-shirts needed in her business. Her earnings greatly support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 11,000, which she will use to buy more number of T-shirts to add to her inventory. The more pieces and colors displayed in her store,  the more sales and thus the more increase in her earnings. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Zaalicah hopes grow her business so she could send her children to the best school possible. She only desires to live a happy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more souvenir shirts needed in her business.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar , es un joven de 22 años de edad, actualmente vive en compañía de su madre, quien le ha dado su apoyo después de perder a su padre. A raíz de la muerte del padre los ingresos en su hogar bajaron a manera de que el joven no ha podido cumplir sus planes universitarios.
A pesar de las circunstancias, Cesar se considera un joven totalmente responsable, honesto y amigable bondadoso como un regalo de su padre el conserva estos valores a lo largo de su vida.
Cesar desea terminar sus estudios universitarios para así poder continuar con su maestría en finanzas y obtener a planes futuros su propio negocio para apoyar a su madre.
Desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país, mediante la generación de empleo, ya que hoy en día es difícil obtener un empleo digno por la situación económica en la que se encuentra nuestro país.
La muerte de su padre le deja una gran enseñanza y es seguir adelante sin importar las situaciones de la vida, ya que todo lo que ocurre es voluntad de Dios. En sus planes a mediano plazo el joven desea tener una granja ganadera.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young man of 22 years of age. He currently lives with his mother, who has supported him after losing his father. Because of his father’s death, the household incomes have decreased, making it difficult for Cesar to accomplish his plans for college. 

In spite of the circumstances, Cesar considers himself to be a responsible, honest, friendly and kind young man thanks to the values that he learned from his father throughout his life. 

Cesar wishes to finish his university studies so he can continue studying for his master’s degree in finance. His plan for the future is to have his own business to support his mother. 

He wants to contribute to the country’s development by creating more jobs, since nowadays is hard to have a dignified job due to the economic situation of the country. 

His father’s dead has taught him to keep going regardless of the situations that life may present, since everything that happens is God’s will. In his middle term plans, Cesar would like to have a cattle farm.

loans.use: to finish his university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more material to produce more floor polish

loans.name: Grace

texts.fr:
_ -  
Agée de 24 ans  Grâce est  mariée  et  mère d’ un  enfant  résidant  à Adidogomé. Elle a commencée  son activité  de  commerce en  vendant des fruits. Elle s'approvisionne  2 fois  par mois au  marché assiyéyé  et  revend  à  son domicile  devant sa maison .  Grâce  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir  son  commerce  afin  de  satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
At 24 years old, Grace lives in Adidogome, is married, and is mother of one child. She has started a business selling fruits.

Grace procures her goods twice a month from the Assiyeye market and makes her resales from in front of her home.

She is seeking a loan to expand her business in order to satisfy her customers and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy 60 bunches of fruit in wooden trays

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more wood for making more doors and windows.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María de 61 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a su hija, ella sola apoyándose en su trabajo de servicio domestico, además buscando tener un ingreso extra 3 días por semana elabora dulces artesanales los cuales vende de forma ambulante en diferentes lugares de mucha afluencia. María desea reparar un cuarto de lámina de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía estas se encuentran en muy mal estado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, alambre y clavos para reparar un cuarto de lámina de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old and lives in her own home with her 14-year-old daughter. She is a woman who, thanks to her tenacity, has managed to advance her daughter. Maria can only help out by working as a domestic servant, plus attempting to generate extra income by making artisan sweets that she sells on foot in different very affluent locations three days a week.

Maria wants to repair a room with rusting laminated metal roof and walls in her home, since, as you can see from the photograph, it is presently in very bad condition. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in: laminated metal sheets, lumber, steel wire and nails for use in repairing the room's walls and roof.

loans.use: invest in corrugated sheet metal, wood, steel wire and nails to repair the walls of a room in her house.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn settled for a living at Misamis Occidental with her family. She has had a fish vending business for over ten years and she was able to provide the needs of her family. 

Her husband does fishing and she had to buy more fish to earn more income than usual. She became a member of GDMPC recently and had borrowed a new loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to save more for their future needs and dreams to improve the living of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en:
Wanjiru is 35 years old, married, and together with her spouse, blessed with four children. She does dairy farming and also grows cash crops for sale. She has been in this business for ten years and it has been profitable.

She will use this loan to buy dairy cattle feeds for her dairy cows. She will also buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more livestock.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to be successful in her farming business.

loans.use: To buy dairy cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy educational equipment for her beautiful daughter

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa tiene 50 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos, vive en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Ella vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juana Rosa se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa y productos de belleza, desde hace más de 7 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia como prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. De esta manera hacer crecer mas su negocio,obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 50 years old, is a live-in partner, and lives with her spouse and children in a house of their own, located in a big community of the urban area of Zaña. 

She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. She lives in the district of Cayaltí, in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the northern shore of Peru. 

Juana Rosa works selling clothes and beauty products. She has done this activity for more than 7 years in a business located at her own place of residence. 

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise, like clothing for women, men and children.  In this way she hopes to make her business grow, obtain more incomes and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, like clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a 53-year-old woman, living with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Irshad’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and paying a daily fair because he does not own his own rickshaw.  He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his siblings and his own family as well.  Now his children are growing older and their needs are growing as well.  He has worried for many days about how to abstain from paying a daily fair, and has decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Irshad  has been saving money for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchase, money had become short.  Therefore, she has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a new rickshaw along with the savings.  He hopes that he no longer has any need to pay the daily fair, which has become the cause of increased expenditures. 

Irshad hopes that now her son will be able to earn additional income; she is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: earn her master's degree.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 55 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposa, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos; su comunidad se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Francisco se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes, desde hace más de 5 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Él solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia como arroz, azucar, aceites y otros. De esta manera hacer crecer mas su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 55 years old, lives with his wife in a house of their own, at a small community in the rural area of Cayalti, and has good personal and work references from his neighbors. 

His community dedicates to agriculture, stockbreeding and commerce. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the northern shore of Peru. 

Francisco has sold groceries for over 5 years in a business located at his place of residence. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, like rice, sugar, oils and others. With this he hopes to make his business grow, obtain more incomes and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, like rice, sugar, oils and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all go to school. She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business on a retail basis from home. She has been in business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy vaccines and poultry feeds. Her major business challenge includes diseases that affect the quality of her chicken. Her goal is to buy more land to expand her poultry business. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
She is Jocelyn, 39, resident of Pasay, Philippines. Married to Ave, a security guard; they have one child. She manages her own household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income to meet the family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Jocelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also offers direct selling products to her customer. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Jocelyn hopes to be able to grow her business and give her child the best education. She only desires to have a happy and quiet life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beverages, toiletries and other grocery products.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que sale a ganarse la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, pero además ha logrado mantener y ampliar una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad gracias a su tenacidad y el apoyo que le ha brindado FUSAI por lo que se siente muy agradecida. Ana observó que gracias al primer crédito logro invertir en productos por mayoreo para su tienda, con lo que logro aumentar su clientela  y sus ganancias, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan dulce, detergente, jabón, etc. para seguir ampliando su tienda de productos de primera necesidad. Ana manifiesta sentirse satisfecha y agradecida con FUSAI por el apoyo recibido, por lo que desea seguir mejorando su negocio con el apoyo de nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and 3 children ages 14,12, and 6. She is a entrepreneurial woman who makes a living selling domestic services. However she has additionally managed to maintain and expand her small convenience store thanks to her tenacity and the support that FUSAI has provided her. For this she feels very grateful. 

Ana noted that thanks to the first loan she was able to invest in wholesale products for her store. Because of this she was able to increase her client base and her earnings. Thus she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, rice, beans, sugar, pastries, detergent, soap, etc. to continue expanding her convenience store. Ana says she feels satisfied and grateful with the support she has received from FUSAI. Thus she wishes to continue improving her business with the help of our institution.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, beans, sugar, pastries, detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and two go to school. She operates a beauty salon at the market in a shop that she rents. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy braids, weaves, relaxers, treatments and oils. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to buy better seats for her salon. 

She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of the small interest. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: To buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers and rollers

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza is an entrepreneur who is married and has three children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than eight years. Little by little with the passing of the time, she has perfected her knowledge. Also she grows wheat. Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Gulnoza is looking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for growing wheat. In this way she will grow more wheat and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, in this way she will be able to offer her son access to be a better quality education and a financial stability that will allow him to progress.  She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and to pay for rental land.

loans.name: Prima

texts.es: La señora Prima, tiene 33 años de edad, se encuentra en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio de Monteagudo, vive y trabaja en su propio domicilio, su actividad es la confección de ropa deportiva como ser poleras, buzos de las cuales genera sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, quienes están estudiando en el nivel primario, actualmente vive con su esposo el mismo trabaja de albañil como contratista. Ahora requiere un crédito para la compra de dos máquinas y materia prima para confección de ropa deportiva, de esta forma podrá incrementar su trabajo y generar mayores ingresos de su actividad para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Prima is 33 years old and she is located in the department of Chuquisaca in the municipality of Monteagudo. She lives and works in her own home and her work is making sports clothing such as jerseys and jogging suits. These generate the income with which she supports her family. She has 2 children who are dependent on her and who are in elementary school. She currently lives with her husband who works as a mason. Right now, she needs a loan to buy more machines and raw materials to make sporting clothes. In this way, she will be able to increase her work and generate more income through her work to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two machines and raw materials to make sports clothing.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, 48 and a mother of five, lives with her family on her own land located in a village of Misamis Occidental. She helps her husband work on their farm to make a living. For over eight years growing bananas, she is happy to say that she has earned a good income for the family. With her revenue, she has made home improvements and saved a portion for their future needs. 

Lilian became a Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) member recently and took out a loan to purchase manure fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs. She is hopeful to have a greener farm with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last three years. She works six days a week. She has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to build a residential house. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utilities and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Wadzanai

texts.en:
Wadzanai is 20 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a school in her community, teaching students life skills. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2012 because she wanted to be financially independent.  

She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Wadzanai would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. She also desires to boost her business and to improve her standard of life. She also wants to assist vulnerable children and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed

loans.name: Zaib Ul Nisa's Group

texts.en:
Zaib Ul Nisa is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband helps her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her repeated loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

Zaib Ul Nisa thanks Kiva, Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages for the general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a dressmaker from Iloilo, Philippines. She is also engaged in a food vending business selling home cooked foods to the people in her place. Teresita has been in these two ventures for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income. She is asking for a loan to buy more cloth and thread, and additional ingredients for her food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to augment her income. In the future, Teresita hopes to make her businesses successful.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and thread, and additional ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina has been running a general store and it is doing well. With her profit, she has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying stock like feeds and grains for sale. Aside from this, she also has a piggery. Her family members helped her in taking over the maintenance of her pigs. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets. Lina learned from her experiences that determination plays a vital role for business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 32 years old and married. Together with her spouse she has been blessed with four children. She is a poultry farmer and also grows cash crops for sale. Her spouse, Joseph, also provides additional income. She has been in the farming business for five years now, and it has been profitable. 

She will use this loan to buy more poultry for rearing. She will also buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, she hopes to be successful and raise her children well.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for rearing.

loans.name: Nilo Ruben

texts.es: El señor Nilo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel bachillerato, por falta de recursos económicos de sus padres, no pudo seguir estudiando y superándose, desde muy joven ya trabajaba junto a sus padres ayudándoles en el chaco, actualmente vive en casa de ellos pero él quiere independizarse y trabajar particularmente por eso hace un año atrás se afilio a una cooperativa de transporte comprándose una motocicleta con sus ahorros, actualmente trabaja como moto taxista en la población de Ivirgarzama, pero por el momento su herramienta está en mal estado y por ello solicita un crédito para comprar una nueva moto, para desarrollar su actividad con normalidad, y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Nilo has a great desire to succeed. He went to school up to the batchelor's degree level but, due to his parents' lacking financial resources, he couldn't continue studying and getting ahead. When he was very young, he began working alongside his parents, helping them on their land. He currently lives in their house, but he wants to become independent, so he is working to achieve this. A year ago he joined a transportation cooperative, buying himself a motorcycle with his savings. He currently works as a motorcycle-taxi driver in the town of Ivigarzama. But, at the moment, his bike is in poor repair and so he is requesting loan to buy a new bike so that he can run his business as normal and make a better income.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo vive en Cercado tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, no cuenta con un casa propia sino vive en alquiler y no tiene dependientes económicos, su principal actividad es el servicios de transporte de pasajeros, tiene su propia línea y trabaja todo los días, es una persona responsable para administrar su actividad tiene amplia experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con su movilidad propia. Ahora requiere un crédito para comprar otra movilidad ya que la que tiene no se encuentra en buen estado, de esta forma lograra mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en: Gonzalo lives in Cercado. He is 25 years old and single. He is economically independent. He doesn't have his own home so he rents and he doesn't have any economic dependents. His primary work is a transportation service, he has his own company and works every day. He is a responsible person and has ample experience running his business and has his own vehicle. Right now, he is requesting a loan to buy another vehicle as his is not in good repair. This will help him to have a better income in the future.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two go to school. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, carrots, and sweet potatoes. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to build rental houses to supplement her income. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes, carrots, cabbages, and onions.

loans.name: Rumnea

texts.en:
Rumnea is a 24-year-old trainee security guard, a married man and also a student at a university. His major is Finance and Banking. He has been a guard for nine months. 

He lives in the Kandal Province of Cambodia. His wife is 23 years old and a garment-factory worker. Together, they can earn approximately $9 a day. 

Because of a lack of finances, Rumnea would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find a better job with a better salary to support his family and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Azada

texts.en:
Azada is a 21-year-old young woman, and she is married with one kid. She is engaged in milk selling. She has three cows now. 

Azada and her husband are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) and they live in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. The income her business generates is about 250 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat) per month, but it is too low to cover the basic demands of her family. 

Milk and dairy products are very popular in Azerbaijan, and that is why she decided to purchase an additional cow and calf. Additional livestock will help her to cover customers' demands, increase income, and thereby, improve the life conditions of her family. Her loan request is 1,500 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and calf

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy silver fish, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, carrots and cassava. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to increase her sales so as to buy a plot of land. 

She lives in rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: To buy silver fish, cabbages, onions and cassava

loans.name: Emil Leonel

texts.es: Emil, tiene 37 años de edad, está casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Las Flores, Lempira.  Tiene su propio negocio de servicio de transporte de personas con una moto taxi, ofrece el servicio de transportar a los pobladores de la comunidad y sus alrededores. Anteriormente tenía una pulpería pero decidió cambiar a uno de transporte de personas. Lleva el tercer ciclo de préstamo en  la institución, el cual es por 5,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para mantenimiento de la moto taxi y pago de matricula anual. Su plan es poder comprar otra unidad de moto taxi. Para ampliar el servicio.
texts.en:
37 year old Emil is married, has 1 son, and lives with his family in the town of Las Flores in Lempira. He has his own transportation service and a moto-taxi. He offers transport services to the people in the community and the surrounding area. 
He previously had a grocery store but he decided to switch to a transportation business. This is his third loan cycle with the institution and he is requesting $250 to buy spare parts and accessories to maintain his moto-taxi and to pay the annual registration fee. His plan is to be able to buy another moto-taxi to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories to maintain his moto-taxi and to pay the annual registration.

loans.name: Billy Joel

texts.es:
Billy es un estudiante natural de Pucallpa, ciudad ubicada en la Selva Peruana, emigró junto a su familia a Lima en busca de un mejor futuro. Su madre es ama de casa y su padre trabaja como estibador, él es el único sustento de su familia.
Billy estudia actualmente Ingeniería Electrónica, y está cursando el Primer Ciclo de la carrera. Para él es muy importante el apoyo que KIVA le pueda brindar ya que de lo contrario, no podría continuar con sus estudios, porque carece de medios económicos que le permitan continuar.
A Billy le interesa mucho su carrera porque es muy innovadora y le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para así poder ayudar a sus padres con el sustento de su familia.
Para Billy, KIVA está realizando una labor admirable al apoyar a estudiantes que quieren culminar sus estudios pero no cuentan con los recursos económicos que le permitan lograrlo y truncarían así el sueño de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Billy is a student from Pucallpa, a city located in the Peruvian rainforest. He migrated along with his family to Lima in search of a better future. His mother is a housewife and his father works as a longshoreman. He is the only wage earner of the family.

Billy is currently studying electronic engineering at SENATI technical institute, and is in the first cycle of the career. For him is very important to have Kiva’s support, since without it he wouldn’t be able to continue with his studies, due to his lack of economic resources. Billy is doing his technical degree with SENATI, one of Peru's premier technical degree programs. 95% of SENATI students find employment within their technical degree within 3 months of graduation. For this reason, and because of a promising labor market, Billy feels this is a good investment in his future.

Billy finds his career very interesting since it is very innovative and will allow him to generate more incomes to support his family. 

Billy thinks Kiva is making and admirable job supporting students that wish to finish their studies but don’t have the resources to do so, since without this help they would have to desist on their dream of becoming professionals.

loans.use: to pay for a technical degree in electrical engineering, so that he can become a qualified professional and successfully perform in the workplace.

loans.name: Gulsaba

texts.en:
Gulsaba is a 55-year-old widow, and she is the mother of five kids. Two kids are married and live separately. Gulsaba is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), and she lives with her kids in the Bilasuvar region. 

She has managed a vegetable production in her village for almost 30 years. She earns a weekly net income of 30 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat), which is usually spent on the family's daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds, Gulsaba would like to get a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase seedlings and fertilizers to use for her vegetable production. She's hoping that her vegetable business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for vegetable production

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina es de estado civil soltera pero vive en concubinato con su pareja en la provincia de Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba, tiene bajo su cargo tres dependientes económicos que son sus hijos que están estudiando en el colegio, actualmente trabaja como concejala en una alcaldía, su pareja es chofer particular trabaja con su movilidad y en sus tiempos libres trabaja en la agricultura para ello la señora solicita un crédito con el fin de comprar abono orgánico gallinaza y semilla de papa para aumentar su producción y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cristina is single but she lives with her partner in the Triaque province located in the Cochabamba department. She has three economic dependents who are her children. They are studying in school. She currently works as a city councilwoman. Her partner is a private driver. In her free time, she works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase manure and potato seeds to expand her production. She will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Ismenia

texts.es: Ismenia, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en la Masica, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de plásticos. Hace 5 años vende medicinas naturales y comunes como ser vitaminas, calcio, desparasitantes, jarabes, y otros, también presta el servicio de masajes y terapias. Ella ha obtenido 5 prestamos con ODEF  con el actual para poder mantener el negocio. Este préstamo es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de medicinas como ser vitaminas, pastillas de hiervas, tratamientos para la piel, jarabes y otras para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mayor ingreso y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Ismenia is 47 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in Masica, Atlántida. Previously, she worked selling plastics. 5 years ago, she started selling natural medicines and health supplies such as vitamins, calcium, deworming powder, syrups, and others. She also offers massage therapy. She has had 5 loans for her business from ODEF, including the current one. This loan is for $1,000 and she will use it to buy health supplies such as vitamins, herbal pills, skin treatments, syrups, and others so that she can offer her customers greater variety. Her plan is to keep growing her business so she can have greater income to help her family.

loans.use: to supply her store with health supplies such as vitamins, herbal pills, skin treatments, syrups, and others

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and four go to school. She operates a food stall selling fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, oranges, watermelon, carrots, and pineapples.

Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to buy a plot of land to start farming, so as to supplement her income. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, oranges, vegetables, pineapples, and watermelon.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and thirteen children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories, doors, and windows, which are usable in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld broken accessories. A few days ago, his welding plant became out of order due to overheating and he needs to replace it with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant, but he does not have cash in hand, due to a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Khalida has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her son will be able to buy a welding plant and iron raw materials for manufacturing.  Khalida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant, and iron raw materials for manufacturing.

loans.name: Laina

texts.en:
Laina is a 25-year-old married woman with one child living in the Mbire District of Zimbabwe. She is a devoted entrepreneur who inspires other young ladies through her work as the owner of a goat-keeping business, which she has been successfully running for the past eight months at her home. She started the business with four goats that she received from her grandmother. 

Laina is also a Learner Guide at her local school, where she teachers life skills education to students. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Laina intends to make bulk purchases of female goats so that she will be able to increase her herd. This will enable her to make greater profits and expand into buying cattle.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of female goats so that she will be able to increase her herd.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and three go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, green bananas, carrots, sweet potatoes and cassava. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to build rental houses to supplement her income. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses includes food and utilities.

loans.use: To buy green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, carrots and onions

loans.name: Manzurat

texts.en:
Manzurat is a careful mother of four children. She is married. Manzurat lives with her family in the south part of Tajikistan. She has been busy with buying and selling men's clothes for more than 17 years. She sells clothes in a local market and has her own selling place. She has a great experience in selling. Manzurat’s elder son helps her with managing the business. 

Manzurat every season renews the assortment of her goods. Now, she is going to buy men's clothes for the new autumn season, but she doesn't have enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy men's clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy men's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is the age of 44 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; one of them goes to school. Her son has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his family. This restaurant has been cherished by her whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers so that he could grow his income.

Safia is receiving a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her son wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. She is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to generate more profit and savings as well.

Safia thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beef, chicken and pulses for cooking then selling from the restaurant.

loans.name: Alejito

texts.es: El señor Alejito, es una persona humilde, mayor de edad, vive en concubinato, por diversas razones solo llego a estudiar  hasta el nivel primario, viven en su casa propia con su esposa, ambos se dedican a la agricultura. Tiene cuatro hijos que viven con ellos y asisten a la escuela para tener una mejor educación. La principal actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que más cultiva son papa, cebolla y cebada en forraje, trabaja sus parcelas propias y en las de su padre. Para mejorar su producción necesita un crédito para la compra de insumos como abono orgánico de gallinaza, así podrá  aumentar sus ingresos económicos que irán a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alejito is an unassuming adult man who lives in common-law marriage. For various reasons, he only studied up to primary level. He lives in his own home with his wife. Both work in agriculture. He has four children who live with them and attend school in order to have a better education. 

The main economic activity in which he is engaged is agricultural production. The main products that he grows are potatoes, onions and barley fodder. He works his own plots and in his father's. To improve his production, he needs a loan in order to buy supplies such as chicken manure. In this way, he will be able to increase his income and that will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chicken manure

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is 18 years old. She lives in the Lupane District of Zimbabwe and sells secondhand clothes for men, women, and children. 

Apart from running her business, Nyasha also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide. She teaches young students communication and leadership skills. 

With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, Nyasha would like to purchase the clothes in bulk so that her sales and profits would increase. With the additional profits, Nyasha would like to further her education by enrolling in a teacher training college and train to become a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is married with an only child. She is settled and living in a village located in Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer, and she raises pigs to earn another income. 

In more than three years of raising pigs, she began improving it by having a fence for her pigs. Before, her shed for her pigs was in the big, cold shadow of the trees in their backyard. 

She became a member of GDMPC this year and has borrowed a loan to purchase additional piglets to raise. In the future, she wants to improve her piggery by having more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Ambrocio

texts.es: Jose de 33 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad, el trabaja como albañil desde hace varios años, muchas persona lo buscan por su buen trabajo, Jose quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de arena, hierro, cemento, ladrillos, etc. y construir un muro donde muestra la foto que es en la parte de afuera de la casa y asi poder vivir seguros con su familia.
texts.en: Jose, 33 years old, lives with his life partner and their three-year-old son. He has worked as a builder for several years. Many people seek him for his good work. Jose wants to improve his home but with what he earns from his job, it is not enough for him to be able to do so.
