For that reason he requests a loan from INTEGRAL to buy sand, iron, cement, brick, etc. to build a wall where the photo shows, which is the outside part of the house, and in that way live safely with his family.

loans.use: to buy sand, iron, cement, brick, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Miurel Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedoras, exitosas una de ella es Miurel tiene 19 años de edad, soltera. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 18 meses. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de pacas de ropa usada para todas las edades como paca de pantalón, de camisas, shores, blusas etc. Maria tiene 48 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa interior, William tiene 37 años y su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos y ropa en los mercados de la capital.
texts.en: The group is formed by three enterprising and successful partners. One of them is Miurel. She is 19 years old and single. Her business for the last 18 months is the sale of used clothing. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of packages of used clothing for all ages, such as packages of pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc. Maria is 48 years old and her business is the sale of undergarments. William is 27 years old and his business is the sale of electrical appliances and clothing in the markets of the capital.

loans.use: to buy packages of used clothing for all ages, such as packages of pants, shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta productos de uso personal desde hace 3 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, la joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: perfumes, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, etc. todo por mayor y asi seguir con sus ventas para tener junto con su madre una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been blurred for being 23 years old and living in a zone of high risk, lives in her own home with her mother. She has worked in the sale of products for personal use for the last three years. She has her business located in her place of residence and she has a lot of customers due to the good prices and the variety of products. The young woman is requesting a loan to buy more products such as: wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, etc., and in that way continue with her sales in order to have, together with her mother, better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale perfume, lotion, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Las Cerezas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias microempresarias exitosas, una de ella es Melba tiene 46 años de edad, soltera su negocio es la venta de cosméticos como perfume, ropa y cartera desde hace tres años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa de  pantalón, camisetas, blusas de adultos y niños, carteras etc. Ada tiene 40 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos  y ropa interior y María tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
This group is made of three successful microentrepreneur members. One of them is Melba. She is 46 years old and single. For three years, her business has been the sale of cosmetics, such as perfume, clothing and wallets. 

She will invest the loan in buying bales of clothing made of pants, shirts, blouses for adults and children, wallets, etc. Ada is 40 years old and her business is selling cosmetics and underwear. Maria is 54 years old and her business is the sale of cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, perfumes, wallets, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Adolfo Felix

texts.es:
Adolfo es un joven estudiante de 29 años, nació en el departamento de Potosí –Bolivia en la provincia Rafael Bustillo de la Localidad de Catavi y es el mayor de dos hijos. 

Adolfo nos comenta que cuando él tenía 9 años, su padre perdió su empleo como minero y su familia tuvo que tomar la decisión de trasladarse a la ciudad de El Alto del departamento de La Paz, para comenzar una nueva vida y buscar mejores oportunidades. La familia de Adolfo es muy unida y siempre se apoyan unos a otros a pesar de las limitaciones y los problemas económicos por los que atraviesan.

Actualmente Adolfo se encuentra en la etapa final de su carrera de Ingeniería Química y para complementar sus conocimientos decidió tomar un curso de Especialista en Sistemas de Gestión de Seguridad y Salud Ocupacional, sin embargo pese al esfuerzo de sus padres, ya no pueden apoyarlo con los costos del mismo ya que sus ingresos económicos solo les alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es por eso que él solicita un crédito educativo. 

Adolfo agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán seguir estudiando y cumplir sus sueños y aspiraciones de ser un excelente profesional y en un futuro formar su propia empresa y apoyar económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a young student, aged 29, who was born in the Potosi department of Bolivia, in the town of Catavi in Rafael Bustillo province.  He is the oldest of two children. 

Adolfo tells us that when he was 9 years old, his father lost his job as a miner and his family had to make the decision to move to the City of El Alto, in the La Paz department, to start a new life and seek better opportunities.  Adolfo's family is very united; they always support each other in spite of the constraints and economic problems that they face.

At this time, Adolfo is in the final stages of his degree program in chemical engineering.  In order to further his education, he has decided to get an advanced degree so that he can become an expert in Management Systems in Occupational Safety and Security.  However, in spite of the efforts of his parents, they can no longer support him with his educational expenses because their income is only sufficient to pay for the household expenses.  Therefore, he is requesting an educational loan.

Adolfo appreciates the people who, through their financial resources, are enabling him to continue to study and accomplish his dreams and aspirations to become an excellent professional.  In the future, he plans to start up his own company and support his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in Management Systems for Occupational Health and Safety

loans.name: Elsa Margarita

texts.es: Elsa de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee un taller de artesanías en el cual elabora jarrones, vajillas, floreros, etc. desde 25 años, su taller lo tiene en su lugar de residencia, vende en diferentes ferias de artesanía que hay en los pueblos cercanos a donde ella vive, Elsa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 2 motores monofásidos, un compresor y una prensa de banco y seguir con las artesanías que muestra en la fotografía.
texts.en: Elsa, 51, lives in her own home with her husband and their daughter.  She has a handicraft workshop where she's been making jars, dishes, vases, and other items for 25 years.  Her workshop is located in her home. She sells her products in the various craft fairs in the towns near her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy 2 single-phase motors, a compressor, and a bench lathe, so that she can continue to make the ceramic items that are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy 2 single-phase motors, a compressor, and a bench lathe

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyugue y sus tres menores hijos de edades 10, 9, 6 años, los cuales cursan primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pomahuaca. Pablo vive 10 años en este distrito, en la parte rural contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Pablo es el transporte de pasajeros mediante mototaxi, cuenta con movilidad propia, esta actividad la realiza en su caserio asi como caserios aledaños y en el distrito de Pomahuaca. Cuenta con más de 3 años dedicandose a este rubro. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio, haciendo arreglos a su movilidad, con ello asegurará el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, lo que en un corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo is 34 years old. He lives in his own home which is made from rustic materials. He lives with his wife and their three children that are 10, 9, and 6 years old. The children attend the local school in Pomahuaca.  Pablo has lived in this area for 10 years and this area has water and electricity services. His home is in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern part of Peru.

Pablo works in transportation.  He transports passengers via his moto-taxi. He provides transportation for the farming communities and other areas around Pomahuaca with his own vehicle. He has done this work for over 3 years. 

Pablo is seeking a loan so that he can invest in his business.  He needs to make repairs to his vehicle so that it operates reliably. By doing this, he can increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his business vehicle to ensure that it operates reliably.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 49 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. She does farming in Tala town, where she grows cash crops to sell and also keeps cattle. She has been in this business for 12 years, and it has been profitable. 

Annah will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting her farm. She will also buy cattle feeds for her cattle. She will use the generated profits to improve her farming and purchase feeds for the livestock. 

This is Annah's third loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her hopes for the future are to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase kapenta (dried sardines) in bulk so as to increase her sales and boost her profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron lives in  Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.

Eron has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 14 years, and she works six days a week. She sells her products in a shop on a retail basis. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from  MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

The main business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el  municipio de El Progreso, Yoro. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio a la venta de mercadería y hace dos años  decidió vender todo tipo de medicinas importadas como ser, vitaminas, desparasitantes, hierro, calcio, reconstituyentes para el cerebro y otros. Vende el producto de manera ambulante en la comunidad y sus alrededores.  Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras, para invertirlo en la compra de vitaminas, reconstituyentes, calcio, hierro etc. Para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Su idea es tener un puesto de ventas para medicina y así tener un mejor mercado.
texts.en:
Gloria is 25 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children. They live in El Progreso, Yoro. She has always worked in sales. 

Two years ago she decided to sell all types of imported medicines such as vitamins, supplements, iron, calcium, etc. She sells her products by foot in her community and the surrounding regions. 

She is seeking a loan of 5,000 lempiras so that she can invest in buying more merchandise. She will purchase vitamins, supplements, calcium, iron, etc. in order to fill the orders of her customers.  Her idea is to someday have permanent a sales location, and thus a better market.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, supplements, calcium, iron, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Medard

texts.en:
Medard is a 36-year-old married man. He has a retail shop selling sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items. He also earns money from a produce business. 

He faces a challenge of limited capital; however he hopes to have enough capital and educate his children. He needs a loan to buy soap, cooking oil, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil, and others items to sell.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing plastic accessories through an injection molding machine for many years. He buys plastic crushing raw material from the market and puts it into the injection molding machine. He manufactures the accessories, sells them into the market and generates enough income to contribute to the family's livelihood.

Lubna is the mother of two children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. Currently she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing plastic bottles so that her husband could increase his sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

Lubna is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more raw material for manufacturing plastic bottles.

loans.name: Yoronim

texts.en: Yoronim is married with five children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and produce-selling store to earn a daily income alongside farming. His dreams are to construct a permanent house and also to improve the status of his business. Yoronim is challenged by the poor road network and low capital. He wants a loan to buy soap, salt and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Sibonginkosi

texts.en:
Sibonginkosi, a 22-year-old businesswoman from Lupane District, Zimbabwe, sells clothing to members of her community, and she also volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide who mentors secondary school students. 

Sibonginkosi is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can buy clothing in bulk, which she will then resell to her customers. She will put the profits earned  towards her siblings’ education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en:
Ilaha is 21 years old, married, and has a daughter. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. Ilaha's   husband is a butcher, but earnings from this job aren't enough and the main source of income for the family is farming.  Ilaha raises and sells seasonal vegetables such as pumpkins, cucumbers, potatoes and so on. She has been raising them and selling at local bazaar for two years and has good experience in this area. Her monthly income is 150AZN.

Vegetables are in high demand in Azerbaijan because people like to use them for fresh salads and delicious national dishes. They attend local groceries and buy fresh and tasty vegetables. They know that vegetables raised in private gardens are always fresh and without pesticides. 

Ilaha needs money to cover her family’s demands. She applied for 1500AZN in order to supply quality fertilizers and increase harvest and income.

loans.use: to supply quality fertilizers and increase harvest and income.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un estudiante que vive en el distrito emergente de San Juan de Lurigancho junto a sus padres y 3 hermanos. Su padre trabaja como taxista independiente y es la única persona que genera ingresos en su familia, su madre es ama de casa.
Juan Carlos estudia está cursando el segundo Ciclo de la Carrera de Electrónica Industrial, gracias al apoyo que recibe de su padre, pero cada vez se le hace más difícil debido a la situación económica que están atravesando, ya que sus hermanos también se encuentran estudiando, es por tal motivo que está recurriendo al apoyo de KIVA. 
Si él no hubiera tenido acceso a este crédito, lamentablemente tendría que dejar de estudiar para poder trabajar y reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita continuar con su carrera. Juan Carlos siente que la carrera que está estudiando lo beneficiaría personal y económicamente, porque le podría dar la tranquilidad económica que tanto buscó tanto para él como para su familia.
Con respecto a KIVA, Juan Carlos, se siente feliz y agradecido de contar con este apoyo y pide lo sigan haciendo para así apoyar a estudiantes que tienen deseos de superación y cuentan con la confianza y el apoyo de KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a student who lives in the emerging community of San Juan de Lurigancho with his parents and three siblings. His father works as an independent taxi driver and he is the only person who generates an income in his family. Juan Carlos' mother is a housewife.

Juan studies and is in his second year of an Electrical Engineering degree, thanks to the support he receives from his father. He is doing his technical degree with SENATI, one of Peru's premier technical degree programs. 95% of SENATI students find employment within their technical degree within 3 months of graduation. For this reason, and because of a promising labor market, Juan feels this is a good investment in his future.

However, his financial situation is becoming become more and more difficult because his siblings are also studying, which is why Juan is seeking assistance from Kiva. If he didn't have access to this loan, sadly he would have to stop studying and start working instead to get together enough money to continue his degree. Juan feels that the degree he is undertaking will benefit him both personally and financially, because it will give him the financial stability that he has been wanting for so long for both himself and his family.

Juan feels happy and thankful that is able to count on Kiva for their assistance. He hopes that they continue to offer their support to students who want to improve their situation with the trust and support of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his technical degree in Electrical Engineering, so that he can become the best in his field

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. En dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Manuel se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Manuel solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Manuel is 57 years old, married and has one son. He lives with his family in a rural area in the Oyotún district in the province of Chiclayo, located in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. His community work in agriculture, livestock raising and business.

Manuel has raised and sold animals in his backyard for over eight years. He is applying for a loan to buy more animals which will help him obtain a wider variety of animals and increased productivity, which will have a great influence on his business.  Manuel believes that by increasing his stock of animals he will be able to cater to the different tastes and needs of the customers in his area.

loans.use: to buy more animals, which will help him obtain a wider variety of animals and increased productivity

loans.name: Lata

texts.en:
Lata is a 34-year-old married lady with three daughters. All her daughters are students in different grades in the village secondary school. She is originally from a remote village, Kathalbari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is known for being hardworking and responsible, with a great desire for personal achievement. Due to lack of economic resources and because of the poverty in which she lived, she did not get the opportunity of higher studies and attended school till grade 7; after that, she got married.

Lata's husband, Nur, aged 43 years, handles his own business of selling mustard oil. It is an essential oil resulting from grinding the mustard seeds and is widely used in cooking in India. He makes his purchases for cash from the markets and distributors in his area in a bulk quantity, then after repacking, sells to the local retail shops. His sales are for cash. He has regular and occasional customers. He began his business many years ago with his own funds and with the goal of helping with the expenses of his household. Today, it is the only source of income for his household.

One of his dreams is to be able to make an increase in the inventory in his business. The current income from the business is insufficient to cover all the expenses. So Lata is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. The purpose of this financing is to invest in working capital by buying more quantity of oil for her husband's business. She hopes the loan will help the business to be a profitable one, will earn more income for the well-being of the family, and will strengthen their economic condition.

Her main goals are to provide her daughters a higher education. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more mustard oil for retailing.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a Ugandan female, aged 30 years, living in Kagadi. She is married with two children, aged 8 and 6 years, and both attend school. She owns a retail shop selling general merchandise, which she started eight years ago. She is challenged by competition from similar businesses. She describes herself as a hardworking woman and has been able to pay for her children’s school fees. 

She wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 26-year-old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge Uganda. She owns a laboratory (clinic) as her main source of income though she also practices farming. She started these businesses with the intention of earning a living and improving her standard of living. Juliet hopes to have a modernized and well known laboratory though she faces the challenges of the lack of capital and the high rate of debtors.

She is requesting a loan to buy more land to enlarge her farming project.

loans.use: to buy more land to enlarge her farming project.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is 36-year-old lady living with her spouse and a kid in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her son goes to school in the morning and for tuition in the evening every day.
 
Her husband drives an auto rickshaw and wants to buy an additional rickshaw for leasing out on a daily rent. He has much saved, but is still some amount short; this is the reason Asmat has requested a loan. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be able to buy the new auto rickshaw. 

She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings to prepare for sudden incidents and to afford the educational expenses of her son. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy an auto rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 30 years old. She is married with two children. Ellen lives in the Mwenezi District, Masvingo province of Zimbabwe.  She rents a table at a flea market at the local business center where she sells clothing. She started her business in November 2013 to be financially independent. She volunteers in Camfed as a Learner Guide teaching students life skills and keeping them in school through counseling sessions and student clubs.
 
With the Kiva loan, she wants to buy clothes for her business like, t-shirts, trousers for men, jeans, women’s sandals and shoes. With the profits, Ellen will buy products in bulk and employ other members of her community to assist her. She hopes to build her own shop. With the profits she receives, she wishes to assist needy children in her community and continue with her education.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Maria Genoveva

texts.es: María de 56 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer admirable por el espíritu emprendedor que siempre ha demostrado, al contar con su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, en el mercado municipal desde hace 10 años, su compañero de vida también aporta a la economía familiar con la venta de frutas y verduras que tiene en su vivienda. María se siente feliz con su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras pero desea ampliar la variedad por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: manzanas, peras, melocotones, mango, anona, piña, etc.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, lives in her own home with her life partner.  She is a remarkable woman because of the enterprising spirit that she has always shown.  She's had a small business selling fruits and vegetables in the municipal market for 10 years.  Her life partner also supports the family's finances by selling fruits and vegetables from their home.  

Maria feels happy with her business selling fruits and vegetables, but she wants to have a greater variety of products, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in apples, pears, peaches, mangoes, sweet sop apples, pineapples, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Godfrey Salongo

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 62-year-old hardworking married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He deals in farming, mostly bananas, as his main source of income. He started the business with the intention of improving his standard of living and look after his family. He earns additional income from his pork joint. He faces the challenges of the lack of capital and price fluctuations, however he has hopes of becoming self-sustaining.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers to improve his farm output.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Kwanele

texts.en: Kwanele is a 27-year-old businesswoman from Lupane District, Zimbabwe. She is a professional barber who also runs a shop where she sells shoes, buckets, and washing soap. Further, Kwanele is a Camfed volunteer. She is a Learner Guide who teaches life skills sessions at the local secondary school. With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, Kwanele would like to purchase some sterilizers, razors, and other equipment that is needed to boost her barber business and she would like to purchase more buckets, soap, and shoes for her shop. This would increase her sales and profit levels. With the additional profits, Kwanele would like to expand her business and create employment opportunities for the people of her community.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for her barber shop and products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives in North Madhabdanga in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. She is the loving mother of two children: a son and a daughter.  Both are students.  She and her husband have a primary education. Her husband is a mason whose income hardly covers the basic needs of the family.

Shefali has been running a business selling milk for many years. She sells the milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter, curd and other dairy products that she makes from the milk. In this way, she earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family fund. With her strong determination and dedication, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she needs to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

In order to expand her business, she wants to purchase a cow and for that she needs money.

So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She will use the loan for purchasing another cow and she hopes to improve her milk supply business.  It will provide her with a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save up for their children's education and future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Lansana

texts.en: Lansana, 37 years old, is married, and has 3 children aged 11, 8 and 4. He has one additional dependent who lives with him, staying with him for schooling.  In 2009, Lansana established his business selling drinks and other confectioneries. He began his business just to enable him to support his wife and children. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. Lansana would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 to buy dozens of rubber drinks, crates of bottled soft drinks and two cartons of biscuits. In the future, Lansana plans to rent a shop at city center and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Sreemati Gita

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Sreemati Gita hails from the village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district.  She is married and a mother of two school-going children (one son and one daughter). She is illiterate and can sign only her name but she sends her children to school.  Her illiteracy cannot curb her spirit and dedication to provide a better life to her children. She helps support her family of five by rearing cattle.  Her children are her greatest motivation for whom she works tirelessly.

Sreemati Gita's husband is associated with a small business but his income is not enough to meet all the expenses of the family. This was the reason that Sreemati Gita started livestock breeding to provide her children with food, health and education.  She rears a dairy cow and sells the milk in her locality.  Hence, she feels the need to have a better income and thereby higher savings, to stabilize her financial condition.

She went to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. There is always a demand for cow milk and she believes her monthly income will increase through this purchase. The loan will enable Sreemati Gita and her family to have a secure and dignified life and the best education for her children.

She is thankful for the lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to continue her milk supply business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: El señor Elías y su esposa Senia viven en el municipio de Colomi,  ambos mayores de edad, económicamente son independientes, el señor se dedica a la agricultura y siembra en terreno propio de 3 Has, produce papa y papaliza, con rotación de cultivos, tiene experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado vacuno 3 yuntas, 1 lechera y 1 ternero. El señor requiere un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa para la siembra, y productos agroquimicos para el proceso de producción ya que últimamente existen muchas enfermedades debido a los constantes fenómenos por el cambio climático, además él quiere incrementar su producción agrícola para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Elías and his wife, Senia, live in the Colomi municipality.  They are both adults and financially independent.  He is a farmer, and he grows on his own land, which is three hectares.  He produces potatoes and ‘papaliza’ [a tuber] by rotating his crops.  He has experience in the field.  He also has some cattle.  He has three teams, a dairy cow, and a calf.  

He needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer (poultry manure) and potato seeds for planting.  He also needs chemical agricultural products for the production process.  Lately there have been a lot of diseases due to the constant climate changes.  He also wants to increase his agricultural production in order to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Francis Geovani

texts.es: Francis de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se desempeña como técnico en mantenimiento en un centro comercial de su localidad, además buscando mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ha logrado sostener una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, contando con el apoyo de FUSAI por medio de un crédito, y es gracias a ello y su tenacidad para los negocios que ha logrado ampliar y mejorar su clientela. Francis desea mejorar aún más su negocio por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente, etc. Francis se encuentra muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que ha recibido, por lo que desea seguir mejorando su negocio con el apoyo de FUSAI.
texts.en:
Francis is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and children. He is a determined man who works as a maintenance technician in a commercial center in his city. In addition, and in order to improve his family’s living conditions, he has also succeeded in maintaining a small shop stocked with basic goods in his house, counting with FUSAI’s support through a previous loan. Thanks to this loan and his tenacity in business, he has been able to expand and improve his clientele. 

Francis would like to improve his business even more, and so is asking for another FUSAI loan to invest in: corn, rice, beans, sugar, oil, ham, detergent, etc. Francis is very thankful to the institution for the support he has received and hopes to continue improving his business with FUSAI’s help.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, sugar, oil, ham, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks for his shop

loans.name: Grupo Genesis Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores microempresarias, una de ellas es Virginia tiene 50 años de edad, es acompañada y se dedica a la hecha y venta de nacatamales, calzados para niños, jóvenes  y adultos, también vende cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat etc. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como quintal de maíz, hoja de chagüites, carne de cerdo, mecate, leña, cal, tomate, cebolla, chiltoma,  naranja agria, ajos, achiote, arroz, papa y la compra de un perol más grande para hacer los nacatamales. Luisa Gabriela mayor de edad su negocio es una mini pulpería y  venta de ropa. Luisa Estela tiene 47 años de edad su negocio es la venta de nacatamales.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of three members who are entrepreneurial small businesswomen.  Virginia, age 50, is one of them.  She is in a relationship, and she makes and sells ‘nacatamales’ [steamed corncakes].  She also sells shoes for children, youth, and adults.  In addition, she sells Avon, Zermat, and other cosmetics.

She will use the loan to buy raw material like 100 pounds of corn, banana leaves, pork, rope, firewood, lime powder, tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, sour oranges, garlic, annatto, rice, and potatoes.  She will also buy a much bigger pot to make the nacatamales.

Luisa Gabriela has a mini-grocery store and sells clothes.  Luisa Estela, age 47, has a business selling nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making food.

loans.name: K.puspanjali

texts.en:
K.Puspanjali is a 38-year-old widowed woman who lives in a small house in Rourkela, the industrial city of Odisha, India with her 13-year-old son. Her son goes to school. For the last 10 years, K. Puspanjali has owned a grocerry store  where she sells daily household items and cold drinks and serves tea, cofee, breakfast and snacks to her customers. From this activity she earns 6,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for her household expenses as her son goes to a public school and his school fees are higher. K.Puspanjali says, "I am ready to work more than what i am doing these days because i want to make my son educated."  She wants to start a food stall with her grocerry shop so that she can make more money and the additional money will help her to pay more for her son's education.

K.Puspanjali has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase a gas stove, gas connection, and raw material for food stall. She is very thankful to kiva for this great support.

loans.use: To purchase a gas stove, gas connection, and raw material for her food stall

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening alongside farming where he earns extra income. He started this business to improve his standard of living and educate his children.  He has hardships of competition and theft of his cows. However, his vision is to own a modernized farm. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to fatten.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to fatten

loans.name: Meraj's Group

texts.en:
Meraj is the age of 31. She lives with her spouse and baby in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruit for many years; he sells seasonal and fresh fruits in his hometown. He uses a four-wheeled manual cart for selling the fruit. Due to his fruit’s freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for his fruit has increased and by noon, his stock is sold out.

Meraj is taking a loan for her husband to buy fruit in a greater quantity. Meraj wants to save the excess profit so she can use the saving for future sudden needs and for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits to resell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 28-year-old hardworking married man with two children who are four and two years old living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a motorcycle that he uses for transporting people and that is how he earns a living, although he also practices farming to earn extra income. He started this business to look after his family. He faces the challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and poor roads while his dream is to diversify his business.

He intends to use the loan to fully pay for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to fully pay for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Himelda

texts.es:
Himelda es una joven de 28 años, nació en el departamento de Cochabamba – Bolivia, es la  mayor de tres hijas, su mamá es profesora y  su papá es jubilado. Himelda actualmente trabaja como auxiliar contable en un centro educativo de la población de Quillacollo que se encuentra a 15 km del centro de la ciudad de Cochabamba, los ingresos que obtiene solo le alcanzan para mantenerse y ayudar en el sustento de su hogar,  por lo que no logro titularse en la carrera de Contaduría Pública.
Ahora ella solicita un crédito educativo para poder financiar su titulación ya que considera que al obtener su título, esto le permitirá optar a un mejor puesto de trabajo y de esta forma cumplir sus sueños de ser una excelente profesional aplicando los conocimientos adquiridos y mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
Himelda agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán obtener su titulación y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Himelda is 28 years old. The oldest of three daughters, she was born in the department of Cochabamba in Bolivia. Her mother is a teacher and her father is retired. Currently Himelda works as an assistant accountant in an education centre in the town of Quillacollo located 15 km from the centre of the town of Cochabamba. With the money she earns she can only afford to support herself and help with household expenses, so she has not managed to qualify as an accountant.

Himelda is now seeking an educational loan to pay for courses leading to this qualification. She believes that she will then be able to get a better job and fulfill her dream of being a proficient accountant. She would be able to apply all her knowledge and improve the financial situation of her family.

She is grateful to those lenders whose financial contributions will allow her to obtain this qualification and reach her dreams.

loans.use: pay for courses leading to the qualification of accountant

loans.name: Tapi

texts.en:
Tapi is a 49-year-old woman from a rural village in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and children in a small house. The couple has three sons and they go to school. 

She is a hardworking mother who struggles hard and tries to give her children everything they need. Tapi and her husband both are engaged in a business of making bori (a conical ball made of pulses) used in vegetable curry in India. They sell the products in the local market and to their neighbors, relatives and friends and earn for their family. They work hard to generate income for their everyday expenses. Yet their income is too low to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family.

Tapi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase ingredients for making more boris in order to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business, which will generate more income. She dreams of earning more profit from her business and hopes to have a comfortable life and further expand her business.

She and her husband are thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for their existing business of "Bori" (a conical ball made of pulses).

loans.name: Grupo Pez Dorado Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras dueña de sus propios negocios, una de ellas es Cristina tiene 21 años de edad, es acompañada y se dedica a la venta de manualidad de fomy y venta de cosméticos desde hace cuatro años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como silicón, fomy de diferentes colores, pega, cosméticos como perfumen de dama, colonias de varón, crema para el cuerpo, cremas para manos, cremas para peinar, pinturas  labiales, brillos labial, vanidades , sombras etc. Paola tiene 26 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pupusas y fritangas y Meylin tiene 33 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de manualidades. Y finalmente Santiago se dedica a la venta de artesanias.
texts.en:
There are four enterprising members in this group, each the owner of his or her own business. One of them is 21-year old Cristina who is married and has earned her living selling craft foam and cosmetics for four years.

The loan Cristina is seeking will be used to buy supplies such as silica, different colours of foam, glue, perfume for women, men’s cologne, body lotion, hand cream, hair cream, lipstick, lip gloss, eye shadows etc.

The other members are 26-year old Paola who sells stuffed tortillas and fried food; 33-year old Meylin who sells crafts; and finally Santiago who also sells handicrafts.

loans.use: buy supplies such as silica, different colours of foam, glue etc.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala tiene 67 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y sus 3 nietos en casa propia en el Sector de Ucupe, donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa, su población se dedica a la agricultura, gaandería y comercio. Ella vive en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Pascuala se dedica a las actividad de cria y venta de animales con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, pues desea realizar la compra de cerdos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder diversificar su negocio, aumentar su stock, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pascuala is 67 years old, lives with her live-in partner and her three grandchildren at a house of their own in the sector of Ucupe, where life is peaceful and harmonious. 

The people there dedicates to agriculture, stockbreeding and commerce. She lives in the district of Lagunas, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the northern shore of Peru.

Pascuala raises and sells animals. She has done this activity for over 5 years, and her business is located in the back side of her house. She is requesting this loan to use it as working capital since she wants to buy pigs.

This investment will help her to diversify her business, increase her stock and her sales, improve her incomes, and by doing so, improve hers and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Rugiatu.  She is divorced and has two children aged 8 and 14 years old. She has one additional dependent who live with her and assists with domestic chores.  In 2005, Rugiatu established her drinks, toiletries and provision business. She began her business just to support herself and her children after being divorced from her husband. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy sacks of sugar, yains of milk and cartons of biscuits. In the future, Rugiatu plans to rent a shop at the city centre and to seek more financial assistance from ARD. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Kulachhum

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Kulachhum hails from Maynaguri. She is married to Ajijul, who is 57 years old.  Both of them have a primary education. They are blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). Their oldest son is engaged in the jute business. The other two children are in college. Kulachhum resides at Kathalbari in Jalpaiguri district with her family.

Kulachhum's husband is engaged in a mustard oil retailing business. He purchases mustard oil from wholesale sellers that he resells to the local retail shops. Being an edible oil, mustard oil is an essential commodity that is used in cooking in most of the houses of their region, so this is a lucrative business. Kulachhum is very pleased with her husband's strategic effort to boost his income. He has increased sales and increased customers. Now he has a successful business, and he can earn income to support his family's welfare.

To support the productivity of his business and to improve the services to his customers, he needs a loan to purchase more merchandise for his business. He will provide for the daily needs of his customers.

To help her husband to enhance his business for the family's welfare, Kulchhum applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She expects that the loan will be utilized to buy more amounts of mustard oil. She hopes the more merchandise she can provide, the more she can serve her customers and increase her earnings. All the profit will be saved for her family's needs.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To buy mustard oil in greater quantities to enhance her husband's business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 27-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a motorcycle that he uses for transporting people and that is where he earns a living. He also sells second hand clothes to earn extra income. He started this business to look after his family. He faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and the high rate of taxation, however his dream is to buy a motor vehicle.

He intends to use the loan to fully pay for his motorcycle and buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to fully pay for his motorcycle and buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sheku

texts.en: This is 53-year-old Sheku.  He is married and has four children who are 9, 12, 15 and 19 years old. In 1993, Sheku established his native rice, garrie, groundnut and pepper business. He began his business just to engage himself in an economic activity. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Sheku has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy a sack of groundnuts, a sack of garrie and a sack of pepper. In the future, Sheku plans to build more houses and to perform a pilgrimage.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more garrie, groundnuts and pepper to sell

loans.name: Leydi Esperanza

texts.es:
Los números, las ecuaciones y las gráficas en matemática siempre le han fascinado a Leydi. Desde primaria siempre ha resuelto las tareas asignadas sin ningún inconveniente, era solidaria con sus compañeros, sí no entendían, ellas les brindaba ayuda. Tiene 19 años, está soltera y cursa  segundo año de un Técnico en Contabilidad de modo regular. Si en algún momento no comprende algún ejercicio en matemática, recibe apoyo incondicional de su padre que es contador. Su madre, dueña de una pulpería la motiva día a día a cumplir sus sueños.
En la actualidad es necesario contar con las herramientas tecnológicas para reforzar el crecimiento profesional, Ledi solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora laptop, puesto que en la mayoría de las materias que recibe tiene que realizar trabajos y enviarlos en línea. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que no quiere retrasarse en la entrega de trabajos, al  mismo tiempo asegura que será una herramienta en la que podrá investigar y adquirir más conocimientos. Entre sus metas futuras está culminar con éxito el Técnico y seguir estudiando para lograr terminar la licenciatura.
texts.en: Numbers, equations and graphs have always fascinated Leydi. Since elementary school, she has solved her assigned homework without problems. She was supportive to her classmates; if they did not understand she helped them. Leydi is 19 years old and single. She is studying the second year of an Accounting certification. If at times she does not understand a Math exercise, she receives the unconditional support of her father who is an accountant. Her mother, who owns a grocery store, is the one who motivates her day by day to achieve her dreams. Currently, it is necessary to have the technological tools to strengthen professional growth. Leydi is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer, since most of the courses have homework to be completed and sent online. She hopes to receive the loan because she does not want to be late handing in homework. At the same time she assures this will be a tool to do research and acquire more knowledge. Among her future goals is to successfully finish her certificate and keep on studying so she can finish her bachelor degree.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children aged fifteen and twenty-two. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her, helping with the house work.  

In 2011, Aminata established her drinks, cooking oil, maggi (bouillon flavouring cubes), onions and pure water business. She began her business to help her husband in taking care of the children. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more provisions for her shop. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. 

In the future, Aminata plans to hopes to expand her shop build a house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for pure water and provisions.

loans.name: Tinuka

texts.en:
Tinuka is a 39-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and three sons in the small village of Petkati Colony in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her children go to school. Her husband is a rickshaw puller, rented from a local owner. 

Tinuka’s husband works under a local rickshaw owner on daily wages.  He has no fixed income. He is the only earning member in the family, but he is unable to make sufficient income.  They are facing acute financial problems and he is unable to give a decent lifestyle to the family and bear the cost of helping his children to rise.

For this reason Tinuka has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a rickshaw for her husband to generate more income. The rickshaw is a very important method of transportation in rural areas. So her husband hopes to earn more income from this for his family. 

Tinuka is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her husband for business purposes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling rice, coffee and maize as his main source of income though he also practices farming where he earns an extra income. He started this business to have a better standard of living. He faces challenges of competition, price fluctuations and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big store and to have educated children.

John is requesting for a loan to buy more rice, coffee and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice, coffee and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries from wholesalers in bulk

loans.name: Mostala

texts.en:
Mostala is a 27-year-old woman from Maynaguri. She is married to Safikul and together they are raising three daughters. They are students in grades 7, 3 and 1. Mostala attended school until grade six and her husband until seventh grade.  They live in Khagrabari, a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.

Mostala's husband is associated with a jute business. He purchases raw jute from farmers and sells it to their neighbors and in the market to those who prepare jute handicraft items like bags, table mats, etc. He is the main source of income for the family. Mostala is a very enterprising and enthusiastic lady. She helps her husband in his business after managing her household works.

Now, Mostala and her husband want to grow their jute business as the demand for jute is increasing day by day. Thus, she is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use the loan to buy more jute.

She has many plans, but her main one is to grow their business and give her daughters a proper education. With the profit from this business, she hopes to fulfill her plans. 

She appreciates her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more jute to sell

loans.name: Deziderio

texts.en:
Deziderio, 48, is married and has four children. The family lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

To make a living and look after his family Deziderio grows watermelon to sell, as well as produce on the side to supplement his income. His challenges as a farmer are inadequate capital and changes in the weather.

Deziderio is applying for a 3,000,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy manure for his farm. He would like to become a more modernized farmer.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Sarati

texts.en:
Sarati is 40 years old and a married woman with three children (one son and two daughters). Her husband Galin is 43 years old and as an occupation sells bamboo in the market. Both of them have completed their education up to grade eight. Two of her children are studying in different grades in the small village school of Maynaguri. One is in college. They live in Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.

Sarati is a housewife. Her husband sells bamboo in the local market. Rural people widely use boo for building materials.  Moreover, bamboo is used in making decorative items, agricultural tools etc.  Bamboo is strong, durable, smooth, clean, non-sliding and resistant to humidity.

At first, Sarati's husband needs to purchase bamboo from the owners of bamboo groves, cuts them into pieces and then sells them in the market. Nowadays, the cost of bamboo is going up. Due to a lack of sufficient capital, they are unable to purchase a large stock.

Thus, Sarati decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality bamboo. She wanted to invest in this business because there is a great demand for bamboo in her area. Almost every poor family in her rural area wants good quality bamboo to make their kachha houses.

Sarati is sure that she will earn more profit from this business. She dreams that she will enhance her business in the future and earn more with the profit from her business. Her main goals are to educate her children properly so that they come out as professionals.

Sarati is happy and grateful to Kiva and BJS after getting this loan.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo for her husband's business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, 53, is married and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. To support his family he grows mainly bananas but also sells other produce such as coffee on the side to supplement his income. His challenges as a farmer are those of inadequate capital and bad weather.

Patrick is applying for a 1,000,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy fertilizer for his farm. He would like to become a more modernized farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is 28 years old and has a primary education. Because of financial difficulty, she was not able to continue as there were many siblings and they were not able to finish their education. She is a young and energetic entrepreneur who deals in the incense business.  She is blessed with two children (one son and one daughter).  Both are students in the local secondary schools.

Her husband Subodh's source of income is selling bamboo. He buys bamboo from the villagers and sells to the local people. Bamboo is mainly used as the raw materials for constructing kachha houses (bamboo and mud-made houses).  The majority of the people in her village are underprivileged people, so there is a high demand for bamboo.  He has considerable experience in this activity.

Their goals are to improve their quality of life, to help with their children's education and improve their business for the betterment of the family, which they hope will be better than the previous year.

Shefali is requesting financial support from BJS (Kiva's partner) for the purchase of bamboo in bulk quantities in order to do the necessary improvement to their business. She hopes through the loan she will be able to reach her goals.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo in large quantity to enhance her husband's business

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. Robinah sells dry foods like maize and beans and has a food stall for her products. She started a business to provide her family's needs. She dreams of educating her children but inadequate capital affects her business.

She wants a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 54-year-old hardworking man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He raises poultry, operates a transportation business and earns a salary from his job. Herbert desires to give education to his children. He wants a loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma de 40 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 20 años de edad y 15 años de edad, el mayor trabaja en actividades agrícolas y la menor estudia 7° grado de educación básica, ambos viven con norma y dependen de ella.

Norma, desde hace dos años se dedica a realizar oficios domésticos ajenos, trabaja en una casa en la ciudad por turnos de que son de 8:00pm a 7:00 am por la noche y de 8:00am hasta 4:00pm los turnos de la mañana. También es agricultor, todos los años cultivan maíz.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizante, plaguicidas y herbicidas para sembrar 7,000 mts cuadrados de maíz y para comprar un toro.

Espera que con las ganancias de la cosecha, pueda seguir dando estudio a su hija, y tener disponible para el siguiente año en la temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Norma, 40 years old, is single and has 2 children, 20 years old and 15 years old. The older one works in agriculture and the younger one is in the 7th grade.  Both live with Norma and depend on her.

Norma, for the past two years, has worked as a domestic worker, she works in a house in the city and her shifts are from 8:00 pm to 7:00 am during the night, and 8:00 am until 4:00 pm for the day shifts.  She also is a farmer, and every year, she grows corn. 

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to plant 7,000 square meters of corn and to purchase a bull. 

She hopes that with the profits from the harvest, she will be able to continue to provide her daughter with an education, and have money available for the next year's planting season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to grow corn and purchase a bull.

loans.name: Grupo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatros socios emprendedores y exitosos, una de ella es Concepción mujer de 36 años de edad, es soltera y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de nacatamales y también se dedica a la confección y costura en su domicilio, tiene cinco años de tener su negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como hojas de chagüites, carne de cerdo, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, achiotes, mecates, leñas, papa, arroz, sal etc. además materiales para elaboración de prendas de vestir como telas, entretela, gruesa de hilo, agujas, gruesa de botones, etc. Edixia tiene 53 años su negocio vende refrescos, repostería, Karla tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de fritanga y Eliseo tiene 39 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, ropa nueva y calzado.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising and successful members. One of them is Concepción, a single 36 year old woman whose business is making and selling nacatamales (a local traditional food). She also does sewing and dressmaking in her home. She has five years experience in this business. She will use the loan to buy raw material like banana leaves, pork meat, peppers, onion, tomato, achiote (a tropical fruit), twine, wood, potatoes, rice, salt, etc. Plus she will buy material to make clothing like fabric, lining, thick thread, needles, thick buttons etc.

Edixia is 53 years old and her business is selling soft drinks and pastries. Karla is 35 years old and her business is selling fried foods and Eliseo is 39 years old and his business is selling used clothing, new clothing and footwear.

loans.use: to buy raw material like banana leaves and pork meat.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 44-year-old married man. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He does farming where he grows sugarcane, which he supplies to Kinyara Sugar Works. He started his business to earn a living and he dreams of educating his children. He is, however, challenged by weather changes.

He wants a loan to weed his sugarcane.

loans.use: to weed his sugarcane.

loans.name: Alindor

texts.es:
Alindor tiene 60 años de edad, es soltero, vive solo, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Cayaltí está ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Alindor se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte en mototaxi, desde hace más de 7 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en la ciudad de cayalti y anexos. Él solicita préstamo para la reparación del motor de su mototaxi. De esta manera asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo y poder seguir obteniendo ingresos para solventar sus gasto y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alindor is 60 years old, single, and lives alone in his own house, in a small community in the rural zone of Cayaltí. He enjoys good personal and work references on the part of his neighbors. Cayaltí is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

Alindor works providing a transportation service on his motorcycle taxi, his business is more than 7 years old, in the city of Cayaltí and neighboring areas. He asks for the loan to repair the motor of his motorcycle taxi. In this way he will assure that his work tool is functioning correctly and be able to continue earning an income to pay his expenses and in this way improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to fix the motor on his motorcycle taxi, and in this way assure that his work tool functions correctly.

loans.name: Yehowa Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the 'Yehowa No" group, which is beginning its third loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. It is made up of four members who operate various businesses including  plates, bowls, dresses, maize and groceries. The loan that they will take out will benefit these small micro enterprises. The members will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

Joyce says that she joined ID-Ghana two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling plates and bowls. She says that she undertook this business at her own initiative, upon seeing that no one was selling these products in her area but that these items were desired by her neighbors.

Joyce will use this loan to increase her capital in order to purchase more plates and bowls in bulk from the wholesalers in Accra. She will then sell them door-to-door. This type of work permits her to generate resources to economically support her son's fees, since she is single. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Joyce answers that she likes the savings program that the institution offers.

loans.use: To purchase more plates and bowls in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs, milk, cold drinks, candies, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Doña Dominga vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesadillas y tortas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios, Doña Dominga esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas moldes y reparar el horno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Dominga lives in her own house with her husband. She works making and selling quesadillas and cakes. Her business has been located in her home for a number of years. Dominga is asking for a loan to purchase more molds and repair the oven that is shown in the photo to be able to continue with her work as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more molds and to repair the oven.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima es una mujer emprendedora y  microempresaria de éxito, tiene 28 años de edad, casada y  su negocio es la venta de tanques de gas butano y una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace tres años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de pulpería como granos básicos arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosas, chiverías, caramelos, pan, medicamentos populares, y envases de tanques de gas para satisfacer la demanda de la comunidad. La cliente lleva varios ciclos de préstamos con la institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos
texts.en: Fátima is an enterprising woman and a successful micro-entrepreneur.   She is 28 years old, married, and her business is the sale of tanks of butane gas and a grocery store which has been located in her residence for the past three years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of products for the grocery store such as basic grains, rice, oil, beans, sugar, soft drinks, dairy products, candies, bread, popular medicines, and tanks of gas to meet the demand of the community. The client has had a number of loan cycles with the institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with the payments.

loans.use: to purchase products for a grocery store such as basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian, 30 years old, is married. He and his spouse have been blessed with 2 children. For the past 8 years, Brian has operated a business selling biscuits, sweets, bottled water and soft drinks. He will use this loan to buy more stock of sweets, biscuits and bottled water to sell. Brian will use the anticipated profits to improve his business and to provide for his family's needs.

This is Brian's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to grow his business and get more income so as to be able to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Fides, who is in her early forties, is married and has three children who are still in school. She has sold cold drinks at wholesale since 2013. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Fides has borrowed and successfully paid back three previous loans through Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of water, juice and takeaway sodas. She also sold fabric and bar soap. She used her profits to pay school fees and various household expenses. She is now doing very well.

Fides is the head of this loan group, Fahari Yetu. On behalf of her group she is applying for a 3,370,000 TZS to be apportioned among the group’s three members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

With her portion of the loan Fides will buy more water, juice and takeway sodas to sell. She dreams of buying a car so she can move her products more smoothly. She also appreciates Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more water, juice and takeway sodas to sell at wholesale.

loans.name: Grupo Bella Cruz Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Elizabeth tiene 40 años de edad, es acompañada y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos desde hace varios años el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, blusas de dama, cosméticos como perfumen de dama, lociones, pintura de labios, pinturas de uñas etc. Lucy tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y prendas de oro y Ana tiene 52 años de edad y su negocio es vender prendas de oro, y plata.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising and successful members. One of them is Elizabeth who is 40 years old and is in a relationship. She has been selling used clothing and cosmetics for a number of years. The loan will be used to buy new clothing like men's and women's pants, men's shirts and women's blouses, cosmetics like perfume for women, lotions, lipstick, nail polish etc.

Lucy is 57 years old and her business is selling clothing, cosmetics and gold jewellery. Ana is 52 years old and her business is selling gold and silver jewellery.

loans.use: to buy new clothing like men's and women's pants, shirts, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Juana Yris

texts.es:
Juana Yris tiene 21 años, es soltera, sin hijos. Vive en casa de familiares en condiciones sencillas, junto a sus padres. En el caserio de Santa Sofia, la población es muy amable y trabajadora, se dedican básicamente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicho caserio se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juana Yris se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace ya 2 años, tiene experiencia en el negocio y es muy conocida por su buen trabajo y calidad de producto que ofrece. Ella necesita del crédito para la inversión en compra de ropa de invierno(casacas, felpas, bufandas, entre otros). Con ello tendrá una mayor diversidad y cantidad de productos para poder asi atender a todos los gustos de sus clientes; lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Yris is 21 years old. She is single and does not have children. She lives in a family home of modest conditions with her parents. In Santa Sofia, the people are very friendly and hard-working. They work in businesses, agriculture and livestock. The community is located within the Cayaltí district in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú. 

Juana Yris has sold clothing for two years. She has experience in the business. She is well known for her good work and the quality of her products. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of winter clothes (coats, jackets, scarves among other items). With these items, she will have a greater variety and quantity of products to cater to all her customer's tastes. In a short amount of time, this will allow her increase her earnings and improve her profit and her quality of life.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of winter clothing.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of 2 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her milk sales business. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. Balqees also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. At present, she has 4 buffaloes and 1 goat. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has currently requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Don Juan es un microempresario exitoso, emprendedor tiene 63 años de edad, casado su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace veinte años el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de pulperías como granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, medicamentos populares, pan, sopas maggi, jabón de lavar ropa, jabón de lavar trastes, chiverías, gaseosas etc. El socio lleva varios préstamos en la  institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en: Juan is a successful small businessman, 63 years old, and married. His business is a grocery store which has been located in his house for the past twenty years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of products for the grocery store such as staples like rice, beans, sugar, oil, popular medicines, bread, instant soups, laundry detergent, dish detergent, dairy products, soft drinks, etc. He has had several loans with the institution and has shown responsibility and punctuality with his payments.

loans.use: to purchase staples for the grocery store such as rice, beans, sugar, medicines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two heifers to fatten and to pay off a motorcycle.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 69 años de edad, es viudo, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela pero aprendió a leer y a escribir por su propia cuenta, tiene 3 hijos de 28 años de edad, 30 años de edad y 35 años de edad, solo uno vive con él.

Antonio es agricultor de granos básicos, oficio que aprendió de su padre y de su abuelo, tiene sembrado 7,000 mts cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 mts cuadrados de yuca, camina 15 minutos desde su casa para llegar al lugar de siembra y en la labor le ayuda su hijo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizante y plaguicida para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos y obtener una buena cosecha para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Antonio, 69 years old, is a widower.  He didn't have the opportunity to go to school, but learned to read and write on his own. He has 3 children, ages 28, 30 and 35 years old. Only one lives with him. 

Antonio is a farmer who grows basic grains, a line of work he learned from his father and his grandfather. He has 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of yucca planted. He walks 15 minutes from his house to get to the fields and his son helps him with the work.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his crops and get a good harvest to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has 6 buffaloes, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income to bear her household expenditures. 

Nasreen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She is currently in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase more animals. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Colleta, 38 years old, has been running a tailoring business for 6 years. She is married and she and her spouse have been blessed with 3 children. Colleta's spouse provides additional income to support the family.

Colleta will be using this loan to buy fabric, sewing thread and buttons for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards. This is Colleta's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, having repaid her previous loan successfully. Colleta's future hopes are to improve her business and become the best businesswoman in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fabric and thread

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 56, is married and has one child. For the past 25 years he has farmed around Juja, which is well-known for its coffee production. He also makes money through other personal efforts.

Joseph is passionate about dairy farming. But as a farmer he faces such challenges as the high of animal feed plus other smaller ones which he is dealing with one by one.

Joseph stated that he joined Juhudi in order to make his dreams for his farm and family come true. Today he is seeking a 20,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimoto buy water piping for a wide variety of uses such as drainage and irrigation. With these installed his cows will have constant access to water and his land will stay well irrigated.
