With a loan Joseph will be able to improve his farm. When he was asked how the loan would benefit his family, he said more milk to sell would mean he could invest in his child’s education.

loans.use: to buy water piping for his farm.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 59 años de edad, es casada, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Victoria se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Victoria piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old, married, without children in her care. She lives with her family in a rural zone in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. In this district, the population works in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade. 

Victoria works raising and selling animals, with more than 8 years of experience in the business, which is located behind her home. She asks for the loan to purchase more animals. This investment will serve her to have a greater variety and productivity of animals, with a strong impact on her business. Victoria plans to increase her stock of animals to be able to meet the diverse tastes and needs of her customers in the area.

loans.use: to increase her stock of animals to be able to meet the diverse tastes and needs of her customers in the area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in merchandise, such as blouses, pants, and tank tops, among others, to supply her business and increase her sales.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. En dicho distrito la població se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio. Las personas son muy amables y respetuosas.

Nery se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Nery is 29 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She lives with her family in a rural zone of the Oyotún District, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru. In this district, the population makes a living from agriculture, livestock, and commerce. The people are very kind and respectful.

Nery makes a living from raising and selling animals with more than 8 years of experience in the business, the same that is located in the back part of her home. She is requesting the loan to purchase animals. This investment will allow her to have a greater variety and productivity of animals with a great influence in the business. She is thinking of increasing her stock of animals to be able to attend to the diverse tastes and necessities of the customers in the area.

loans.use: to purchase more animals, and this investment will allow her to have a greater variety and productivity of animals.

loans.name: Leydi Noemy

texts.es:
Leydi de 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, su esposo es agricultor y en temporadas trabaja en albañilería.

Leydi tiene una pequeña tienda de artículos de canasta básica, no la puede tener en su casa por lo que tiene que caminar cerca de 15 minutos para llegar. Además cuida a su hija mientras su esposo trabaja.

El préstamo ser utilizado para comprar mercadería que vendrá a aumentar el inventario de la tienda, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, bebidas, y demás, al comprar al mayoreo es más barato  tomando en cuenta que tiene que viajar a la ciudad y pagar vehículo para poder hacer la compras de la tienda.

Leydi se proyecta en el futuro su hija sea persona de bien y con su tienda sacarla adelante, que se mantenga sin competencia para que sea la principal fuente de abastecimiento en la zona.
texts.en:
Leydi is 28 years old. She is married and has a 3-year-old daughter. Her husband is a farmer and for some seasons works in construction.

Leydi has a small store of basic needs. She cannot have it in her home because of which she has to walk around 15 minutes to arrive at her store. Furthermore, she takes care of her daughter while her husband works.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise that will come to increase the inventory of the store, such as rice, sugar, beans, drinks, and others. To purchase wholesale is cheaper, taking into account that she has to travel to the city and pay for the vehicle to be able to shop for the store.

Leydi hopes that in the future her daughter is a well-to-do person, and brings her out ahead with her store, which she maintains without competition because of which it will be the main source of supplies in the area.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, drinks, and others for the store.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia, age 39, is a married woman. She is in business, selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk, to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business, to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. She will use the loan to purchase more cattle. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle, with a good credit history

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia is 29 years old, a married woman, and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother, who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. Her husband (shown in the photo) assists her in stitching clothes. They know very well the techniques of stitching and earn enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She will use it to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and lace with which to meet the increasing demand.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and lace

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Hanifan is 39 years old and a married woman, and she is the mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Hanifan’s husband. He is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years, to meet the family's expenses. Now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Hanifan has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with auto spare parts, for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Hanifan hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and that it will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts for the rickshaw

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is 36 years old and a married, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years, to contribute to the family's income. She offers various handmade carpets, in different colors and designs, to the people of her community. With this work, she earns enough to lead a decent life.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 55,000. She will use the loan to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality fibers for carpet-making

loans.name: Yasmain

texts.en: Yasmain is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 12 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is the mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar, oil and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her ninth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, oil and flour.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 24-year-old lady. She has been running a business purchasing and selling cattle for the past four years. She purchases cattle from the city market at lower rates and sells them in her locality. The income is used to support her entire family. She is in her fourth loan cycle. Now, she has requested an amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more cattle for resale purposes, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She dreams of extending her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 51-year-old married woman who has been running a school for ten years. She charges low fees so that students from low-income households can afford a quality education. Her strong management skills are a major reason her school has been running successfully so far.

Nargis is applying for a 100,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to buy more chairs for her students so as to provide them with an environment conducive to learning. She would also like to purchase a swing set for the younger students.

Nargis is committed to providing a quality education and good facilities to the 150 boys and girls in her school.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and a swing set

loans.name: Ferdoss

texts.en:
Ferdoss is a 47-year-old, married woman, and a mother of nine children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous in her area, for providing good-quality milk.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Most recently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for dairy use

loans.name: Thendral-I Shg - Thirunaraiyur Group

texts.en:
PAT (People’s Action for Transformation) manages the Self-Help Group (Shg) called Thendral-I, which consists of ten members in the same locality in Tamil Nadu, India. PAT helps the members to improve the livelihood of the people. Usharani is the leader of the group, and she lives in Thirunaraiyur village, Ariyalur district.
  
Usharani is married and lives in her own house with her two children and husband, who is a farmer. Usharani has previously taken loans from PAT to improve her livelihood, and always repaid the loans on time.

Usharani and the other members are requesting the loan to buy a smokeless stove, which costs 1,400 rupees. It is better than the traditional mud stove. The traditional stove creates more smoke and soot. Smokeless stoves are affordable and comfortable for cooking and produce less carbon dioxide compared to the traditional stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cookstove.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina, age 43, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products in bulk

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Onua Do, which is located in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of two hardworking members, both of whom have attended school. They primarily speak the main languages Ga and Twi. They have succeeded in managing their businesses and providing income support for their families. They sell maize, cassava, fresh fish, ladies skirts, dresses and scarves.

Caroline is the group’s featured borrower. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Caroline’s business is selling foodstuff (maize, cassava and fresh fish) which she sells throughout the week. She sells at her residence. Caroline is requesting a loan which she will use to buy more foodstuff (maize, cassava and fresh fish) to sell to her customers. Her income has helped her give her children an education, take care of her home and reinvest in her business. Along with Caroline, the other member has completed four loan cycles with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. These loans have helped increase their small businesses. They are extremely grateful for the support of ID-Ghana and its partnership with Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff (maize, cassava and fresh fish) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 37-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of funds, Nasreen is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason Nasreen has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of thread in different colours to create a means of increasing revenue so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behaviour.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of thread in different colours

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
Debra is 47 years old. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children. She has a hotel business, which she has been running for five years now. She makes a monthly income of 60,000 KES. She also has a mobile money transfer business.

She will be using this loan amount to buy more stocks of maize and wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs and rice. She will also use part of the amount to add money float to her mobile money transfer business. She will use the anticipated profit to improve her business.

This is Debra's third loan term from VisionFund Kenya. She repaid her previous loans successfully. Her hopes for the future are to grow her business and to be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of food for use.

loans.name: Evidence

texts.en: Evidence is a 20-year-old entrepreneur living in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. Evidence lives with her mother and five sisters. She volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide at her local school. In this program, she teaches students about life skills and encourages them to stay in school. In December of last year, she started a business selling groceries. She sells products like powdered milk, sugar, rice and biscuits. She began her business because she saw that it was profitable in her community. Evidence would like to increase her sales and create employment for other members of her community. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more products. She intends to use the profits to add more shelves in her shop and further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more products to increase her sales

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past 10 years, has been running a cloth-selling business. Rani buys cloth in various fabrics, colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and to expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 15 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas apoyada por medio de la venta de tortillas la cual realiza desde hace 10 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos. Sonia desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cables eléctricos, caja térmica, interruptores, etc. Para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Sonia, 42 years old, lives in her own home with her two daughters, who are 13 and 15 years old.   This woman, thanks to her efforts and tenacity, has succeeded in helping her daughters get ahead.  She has found support for the past 10 years in the sale of tortillas that she carries out, counting on a large number of customers who always seek out her products.  Sonia wants to put in electricity in her home, and for this reason is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy electrical cables, a terminal box, interruptors, etc.

loans.use: to invest in electrical cables, a terminal box, interruptors, etc., in order to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el caserío el Muñuño en el centro poblado de Huacapampa, en el distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Aurora se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, desde hace más de 10 años en el caserío Muñuño. Aurora necesita del crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno, es decir ella desea comprar ganado flaco para engórdalo y luego venderlo. Aurora posee invernas en donde cria a sus animales, y posee experiencia en el negocio.
texts.en:
Aurora is 35 years old, and lives with her partner and their young child, in the small village of Muñuño in the population center of Huacapampa,  Cañarís district,  Ferreñafe province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

For more than 10 years, Aurora has worked at taking care of cattle in the village of Muñuño.  Aurora needs a loan to buy cattle, that is to buy a skinny animal and fatten it and then sell it.  Aurora has pastures where she cares for her animals, and has experience in this business.

loans.use: to buy a thin  animal to fatten and sell

loans.name: Firdus

texts.en: Firdus is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been running a cattle business along with her husband. At present she has two cows. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them in different markets in the city. Their business provides them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Firdus has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Parasakthi Shg - Kurukoor Group

texts.en:
Suseela is the featured borrower of the “Parasakthi” SHG (Self-Help Group ). The local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) has been financing this group with loans for the last seven years. With the loans, the borrowers have been able to improve their livelihood through the cultivation of crops. Through NGO training, the women in the group are empowered and have grown strong morally.    
                                                                                          
Suseela lives in the rural village of Kurukoor in the Tanjore District of Tamil Nadu, India. She is married and a mother of two children. Her husband is a farmer by profession. 

Suseela and her group are requesting a loan in order to purchase a smokeless stove for their own families. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste and is therefore highly sustainable. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Not only will the stove help save money for each family, but it will also decrease overall air pollution in the village.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Thendral-Ii Shg - Thirunaraiyur Group

texts.en:
Thendral-II is a Self Help Group in Thirunaraiyur village, Tamil Nadu, which is under the local NGO called “PAT.” The group has been in existence for more than three years. The total number of members in the group is 10. Kalyani is the leader of this SHG. She is married, and her husband is a farmer who even runs a tea shop. They have a child, and the family is living in their own house.    

The members of the group have taken loans from “PAT” for three years, one after another, and repay the loan amount regularly on time. They have taken loans to improve their livelihoods.           

Now the group members need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is produced by Greenway Grameen Infra. This stove costs the very low price of INR 1,400, and the reduction in indoor air pollution means healthier women and healthier families. Healthier indoor air quality benefits young children and women who spend the maximum amount of time in and around the kitchen.

Your lending will help these women to live healthier lives.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a fish-selling business in Tala town and has been doing this business for 10 years now. She is 42 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of fish to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mayil Shg - Kumbakonam Group

texts.en:
Latha (with her hand raised in the photo) is the leader of the Mayil Shg (Self Help Group), which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Kumbakonam village in the Tanjore district. Latha is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her two children and husband. Her husband is a small marginal farmer.  

Latha is requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than the traditional mud stove. As the latter emits a lot of smoke, it is also called a kitchen killer as it consumes more time and money. A smokeless stove is affordable, designed for daily use and is much better than the traditional stove.

Along with Latha, the other members are requesting a loan for the same purpose and are hoping for a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Maqsodain

texts.en:
Maqsodain is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns four buffaloes and two cows. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. 

She is happily supporting her family. She is in her seventh loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that the increase in milk production will help her in increasing her sales and profits alongside it.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Richmond

texts.en:
Richmond is a second-year student at Principal’s College, a private tertiary institution, and is reading Logistics Management. He accessed this loan to help pay for his fees.

He loves to share with the needy and communicate with people of all kinds, and he believes with his chosen career he would be a blessing to his family, community and the nation of Ghana as a whole.

He draws his inspiration from people of great stature, because of the strides they took to get to the height they have reached in their various careers. In the years to come, he sees himself running his own logistics and supply chain firm, and this would move him to a higher pedestal in his career.

But for the help of this loan, he would have to defer his course and wait for the next academic year to complete his education. Needless to say, his next line of action would have been to use his monthly salary to settle his fees.

His country is made up of great talents who are lacking the financial support to make their dreams a realization. Also, he commends investors for such good inventiveness.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Mullum Malarum Shg - Kadambangudi Group

texts.en:
Vijaya (shown with her hand raised in the photo) is the leader of the Mullum Malarum Shg (Self-Help Group), which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. Vijaya lives in Kadambangudi village, Tanjore district.    

Vijaya and her family live in their own house. Her husband is a farmer.

Vijaya and other members of the group have taken loans from PAT before for improving their livelihood. They all are seeking a loan to purchase smokeless stoves, which are efficient, sustainable, durable and designed for daily use. 

The traditional mud stove is very inefficient and emits a lot of smoke and soot, which creates many health problems. This loan will help these women have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 femmes fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 21 décembre 2012. Il est composé de femmes travailleuses qui s’activent dans le commerce, l’embouche et l’agriculture. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et habitent le même village.
Ndella, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 filles. Elle fait comme activité principale le commerce. Elle vend des œufs, des légumes et toute activité génératrice de revenue. Elle sert aussi le petit déjeuner.
Les bénéfices sont réinvestis dans ses activités mais aussi vont servir à renforcer son épargne et à assurer les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group of 24 women belongs to the village financial association, created on December 21, 2012. It is composed of hard-working women running businesses in retail, animal husbandry, and agriculture. They have good relations with one another and live in the same village.

Ndella, who is standing to the right with her hand raised in the picture, is 57 years old. She is married and has three daughters. Her main business is retail. She sells eggs, vegetables, and anything that will generate sales. She also serves breakfast.

Profits are reinvested in the business but also used to increase her savings and pay for the household’s expenses.

loans.use: ti buy eggs and vegetables

loans.name: Rebah

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rebah, a 35-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Chetamba, a remote village in the Bungoma area of Kenya. She is happily married and has three children that depend on her for the basic needs. 

For the past two years, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her major primary sources of income are egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” 

She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and, because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound, and the demand has been overwhelming. To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity, and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used in improving her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and hence, provide a secure solid education system to her children

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Séli

texts.fr:
_ -  
Agée de 52 ans,  Séli est  mariée  et  mère d’ un  enfant  résidant  à Adidogomé. Elle a commencée  son activité  de  commerce en  vendant  du bois  et  du charbon de bois. Elle s'approvisionne  3 fois  par mois au  Kpalimé  et  revend à la devanture de  son domicile.  Séli  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir  son  commerce  afin  de  satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
At age 52, Séli is married and a mother of one. She lives in Adidogomé. 

She started in retail by selling wood and charcoal. She procures her supplies three times a month from Kpalime, and resells from the front of her house. Séli is requesting a loan to grow her business so that she can meet demand from her clients and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy five bags of charcoal and 10 bags of wood.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 femmes fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 21 décembre 2012. Il est composé de femmes travailleuses qui s’activent dans le commerce, l’embouche et l’agriculture. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et habitent le même village.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants tous des garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale l’embouche bovine. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle achète un veau à 125000 F, garde comme fonds de roulement 25000 F. La durée de l’embouche est de 5 à 6 mois. Elle le revend à 250000 F au marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. 
Les bénéfices serviront à la scolarité des enfants, mais aussi à prendre en charge sa famille et ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group of twenty women belongs to the village financial association, created on December 21, 2012. It is composed of hard-working women running businesses in retail, animal husbandry, and agriculture. They have good relations with one another and live in the same village.

Fatou, who is standing to the right with her hand raised in the picture, is 51 years old. She is married and has five children, all boys. Her main business is cattle farming. She procures the animal from weekly markets. She buys a calf for 125,000 F and keeps 25,000 F for expenses. Fattening the calf takes five to six months. She resells at a price of 250,000 F to a weekly market in her town.

Profits will be used to send her children to school, but will also go towards her family’s and her own expenses

loans.use: to buy one ox.

loans.name: Chemi

texts.en: Chemi is a 22-year-old entrepreneur living in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. She is volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide at a local school.  Here she teaches students about life skills and encourages students to stay in school. In November last year, she started buying and selling clothes. She sells products such as women’s sandals, T-shirts, and school uniforms. She will use the Kiva loan to increase her inventory to improve sales and profits. She hopes that one day she will be able to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to increase her clothing inventory.

loans.name: Amy Aladji's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 11 avril 2010. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des environs. Elles sont solidaires  et font  comme activités génératrices de revenus, le commerce et l’embouche.
Mbackhe, debout sur la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 garçons. 
Elle envisage de faire du commerce et de l’embouche. Elle va acheter avec le prêt des légumes et dépense 15000f chaque semaine. Elle achète aussi 3 béliers  à 50000f chacun, de l’aliment de bétails pour engraisser les sujets. Une fois les moutons bien les nourri, elle compte revendre un bélier à 100000f.
Les bénéfices permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et de gérer ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group of 28 women belongs to the village financial association created on April 11, 2010. It is composed of members who live in the same village and its surrounding area. They help one another and their businesses are retail and animal husbandry. 

Mbackhe, who is standing with her hand raised in the picture, is 33 years old. She is married and has six children, two of them boys.

She plans to have a commercial business and to fatten animals. With the loan, she will purchase vegetables, spending 15,000 F on them weekly. She will also purchase three rams at 50,000 F a head, as well as cattle feed to fatten them. Once they have been properly fattened, she expects to resell them for 100,000 F a head. 

Profits will be used to improve her savings and pay for her personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and sheep.

loans.name: Clemence's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 11 femmes,  fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 11 avril 2010. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des environs. Elles sont solidaires  et font  comme activités génératrices de revenus, le commerce et l’embouche. 
Clemence, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 3 filles.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter divers produits alimentaires à savoir : 3 sacs de savon en poudre à 7500f, 1 sac de sucre à 27500f, 3 bidons d’huile de 20 litres à 16000f, du tabac pour une valeur de 6000f.
Les bénéfices lui permettent  de verser ses intérêts et de renforcer ses épargnes  au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of 11 women belongs to the village financial association created on April 11, 2010. It is composed of members who live in the same village and its surrounding area. They help one another and their businesses are retail and animal husbandry. 

Clemence, who is standing to the right with her hand raised in the picture, is 47 years old. She is married and has seven children, three of them girls.

With the loan, she will purchase various food products, namely: three 7,500 F bags of powdered soap, one 27,500 F bag of sugar, three 16,000 F 20-liter oil cans, and 6,000 F worth of tobacco.

Profits will be used to pay the loan’s interests and to increase her savings in the village’s association.

loans.use: to buy various food products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married with three children, ages 16, 24 and 26 years old. In the year 2000, Mary established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed to take care of her children. Working six days a week, nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business.

Mary would like a SLL 4,000,000 loan to buy bamako clothing for resale. Bamako clothing is an expensive, prestigious Africana dress for special ceremonies. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. It will help her to improve her business. In the future, Mary plans to establish a big shop and educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Bamako material to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 55-year-old Ugandan man who lives in Masindi, Uganda.  He is married with six children.  When he realized that he needs to take care of his large family with little income, he decided to set up a supermarket and build rentals to supplement his income.  He wishes to educate his children but is challenged with limited funds, which hinders business expansion.  He wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 40-year-old married man with nine children, two of whom attend school. He farms cassava and bananas and also earns a salary. He faces a challenge of seasonality but hopes to buy land and build a permanent house. He needs a loan to buy herbicides so as to improve his farming.

loans.use: to buy herbicides.

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en:
Janifer is a strong, resilient, 61-year-old Kikuyu farmer who has been running a mixed-farm for close to three decades. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, and a side business.

This mother of two loves horticultural farming. However, she is taking a step further to diversify in order to increase her income and reduce her income vulnerability. She is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats.

Dairy goat farming is a very profitable business in Kerugoya. Goats need to be milked at least once a day, seven days a week, rain or shine, cold or hot, until they dry off. Besides, she always wanted to keep dairy goats to provide her fresh and free goat milk, goat meat, goat cheese and goat yogurt. The good thing about goat milk is that you don’t have to worry about antibiotics and hormones in the milk.

This investment is bound to bring Janifer great sustainable profits which she will use to pay her loan and other farming expenses. When asked how her family will benefit from the loan, she replied, “'I will be able to educate my child and also provide food for family".

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Geresomu

texts.en:
Geresomu is a hardworking, 43-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. He started this business to improve his standard of living. He still faces challenges of competition, price fluctuations, and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big store and educating his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening, in addition to farming. He started this business to increase his income and to look after his family.  His hardships include competition and price fluctuations.  Nathan has a vision of owning a big and advanced farm.  He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Kihondo Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Specy is a 56-year-old woman with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a member of Kihondo Abagambakamu, where each member guarantees the other so as to access credit.  She operates a bar and does farming in order to boost her income. The challenges she faces include bad debtors and inadequate capital. She hopes to expand her bar to new places. Specy needs a loan to buy crates of beer, sodas, and waragi for sale in the bar.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, sodas and waragi.

loans.name: Weya

texts.en:
Weya is 30 years old and married with two children, ages two and three years old. In 2012, Weya established her tailor shop, which includes a planting machine and zigzag machine business. She began her business because she learned tailoring when she was 18 years old. As a result, she decided to open a shop to increase her earnings and profits. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 780,000 every month from this business.

Weya would like a SLL 4,000,000 loan to expand her business and purchase more Ghana batik. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and improve her business. In the future, Weya plans to educate her children and build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more Ghana batik.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice does farming in Tala town, where she grows/sells cash crops and keeps dairy cattle. She is 24 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with one child.

Eunice will be using this loan to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer. She will also buy cattle feed. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and provide the basic needs for her family. This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, Eunice hopes to grow her farming business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm input, such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking, 40-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

Joseph deals in coffee farming, which he started in order to improve his standard of living and to educate his children. He also earns additional income from brewing alcohol and selling produce. His main challenges are inadequate capital and price fluctuation. He hopes to increase his profits and have educated children. He is requesting a loan to buy seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Lawrent

texts.en: Lawrent is a 41-year-old, hardworking, married man with four children aged 10, 8, 6, and 2 years old, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle rearing, a business he started to improve his standard of living and to educate his children. He also earns additional income from coffee growing and selling. He hopes to become a very prominent businessman in the future despite facing challenges from stiff competition and price fluctuations. He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a married mother of two adult children. She works with her husband in a village, working in livestock and agriculture. She has goats and makes goat cheese. Her friends and acquaintances place orders and she sells it. She contributes to her family’s income and the national economy. Customers prefer her product because she makes it naturally without additives. With the loan from Maya she will buy animal feed.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Fatma Hanım,evli yetişkin iki çocuk annesi. Bir köyde eşiyle beraber çalışıyor. Hayvancılk ve tarımla uğraşıyor. Küçükbaş hayvancılık yapıyor. Keçileri var, keçipeyniri yapıyor . Çevresi şipariş veriyor ve satıyor. Aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Yapmış olduğu peynirler doğal ve katkısız alıcı onun için tercih ediyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile yem alacak.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en: Mathias is a hardworking, 46-year-old married man with two children.  He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda and sells coffe and maize.  He started this business with the intention of improving his standard of living and looking after his family. He also earns additional income from farming.  He faces challenges of price fluctuations and limited capital.  Mathias hopes to become self-sustaining.  He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee and maize.

loans.name: Ceren

texts.en:
Ceren, who has two children, began working after she and her husband separated. Because she had limited options, she opened a small communications center. She now has two people who work with her. With the loan from Maya, she’ll make cake and savory pastries at home. She will sell them nearby and at stands. She wants to prove herself in this area as well. She wants to ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ceren Hanım, iki çocuk annesi eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra çalışma hayatına başlamış. Kısıtlı imkanlarıyla küçük bir iletişim merkezi açmış.Kendisine şimdi yanında iki kişi yardım ediyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile evden pasta ve börek yaparak yakınlarına ve standlarda satmaya başladı. Kendisini bu alanda da ispat etmek istiyor .Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Isata H

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Isata.  She is married and has three children who are 19, 17 and 7 years old. In 1999, Isata established her wood and charcoal business. She began her business to take care of her family and improve their standard of living. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about 780,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to expand her business by purchasing more wood and charcoal. In the future, Isata plans to educate her children and construct a building for the business. Transporting her charcoal from the province to the city is her biggest challenge. She is looking forward to receiving funds that will help her to develop her business so that she can save enough for the family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase wood and charcoal

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He raises cattle and sells milk as his main source of income, a business he started in order to improve his standard of living. He also earns extra income from being an LC III chairman. Stephen hopes to become a very prominent businessman in the future, though he faces challenges from animal diseases and price fluctuations.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to raise.

loans.use: buy more cattle to raise.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is raising and cattle, along with farming. He started this business to increase his income and to look after his family. Moses has hardships of competition, lack of capital and price fluctuations, however he has a vision of owning a big, well-known and advanced farm. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows to raise and sell for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to raise and sell for his farm.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 37 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with five children aged between 17 and 5 years old. 

Everlyne has a tailoring business which she has been running for 14 years now. She sells and supplies fabric materials and also makes dresses, shirts and school uniforms. She will use this loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric materials for use in her business. She will use the profits that she generates to educate her children and service the loan.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to prosper and live a good life with her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric materials for use in her business.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 36 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. 

Felistus sells charcoal and has been in this business for seven years. She will use this loan to buy more stock of charcoal to sell, and will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family.

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loans successfully. She hopes to be successful in her business and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to the rescue of Corazon by lending her money when she needed it the most. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Corazon perseveres and always desires to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats to raise.

loans.name: Recardo

texts.en:
Recardo is a 55-year-old widow from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is a businessman and his expertise is in selling. He runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family. 

Recardo is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without any record of default. Now, he applied a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more stocks of basic commodities and other consumable items. Recardo continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Kiva Lenders! Meet Nahashon, aged 45, who lives in Kutus, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. 

Kerugoya area is an area where hard core poverty pervades every home, yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people: a sea of about 50,000 bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible. They are like the bones in the “valley of dry bones” that required only a breath to spring back to life. 

Armed with this conviction, Nahashon has been toiling in his farm for the past 27 years .His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that he engages in to the make ends meet. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve. He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. Nahashon passionately loves dairy farming and as he likes to put it “dairy farming is close to my heart”. He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit the from cow manure which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a bio-gas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Nahashon waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, aged 51, is from Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lilian earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. 

For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more clothing to sell. Lilian hopes to live comfortably and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emecris

texts.en: Emecris signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Emecris is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, candies, drinks and rice. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, candies, drinks and rice.

loans.name: Jenevie

texts.en: Jenevie joined PMPC for her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first bsuiness went bad. PMPC came to the rescue of Jenevie by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Jenevie perseveres and always strives to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seabed preparation.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: In the year 2009, Oliva learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start corn production. After several months, She was able to return the borrowed capital. Oliva feels she owes this good fortune to the Co-operative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Oliva wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neigboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
La socia María Belén pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 56 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el  cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zanahorias.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Belén is one member of the San Jose Communal Bank, which is located in the department of Cusco.  She is 56-years-old and separated, and she has 2 children.  She alternates her daily work with a business selling vegetables in one of the city markets in Cusco.  She has had this business for a long time and it is going well for her thanks to the determined attitude that she brings to her work every day.  She wants to be able to continue working as she has been and supporting her family.  

She is asking for a loan to buy carrots.  She is grateful for the loan and she is dedicated to completing her established quotas.  

The member who appears in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy carrots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the sheet metal on the walls of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, bricks, and windows to construct a wall and install windows in her home

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa tiene 44 años, es conviviente, conocida en el medio por la labor de compra y venta de animales. Ella vive en casa propia, con conyuge e hija, su conyuge trabaja como jornalero agrícola por zona de residencia. María Elsa cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales, su familia es muy unida.

María Elsa vive en una comunidad ubicada a 39 kms de chiclayo, conocida por sus dulces tipicos y sus famosas ruinas de Zaña, en la cual vive gente respetuosa y trabajadora, dedicadas al comercio, ganaderia, y agricultura, la misma que está ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Elsa se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como ganado vacuno, caprino y porcino, desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente y necesita del préstamo para invertir en compra de ganado vacuno (lechero), el cual le reportará mayor ingreso a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
María Elsa is 44 years old and lives with a partner.  She is well-known in the business of buying and selling animals.  She lives in her own home with her partner and her daughter.  Her partner works as an agricultural day laborer in the residential zone.  María Elsa has many good professional and personal references, and her family is very united.  María Elsa lives in a community located 39 kilometers from Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

She has worked in the business of buying and selling livestock such as cows, pigs, and goats for more than 10 years and she needs a loan to buy milk cows, which will bring in a larger income to her family unit.

loans.use: to invest in milk cows

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is a 47-year-old married woman from Batumi city. She lives with her school-aged son and daughter and earns a living with the help of her husband's transfers. They belong to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income and live in poverty.

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. So, Tsitsino decided to start her own business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative between of Kiva and Credo's start-up program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

She plans to purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and sell it in her community door-to-door. Tsitsino will be able to generate income and somehow increase the living condition of her family. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing and start trading.

loans.name: La Delivrance 2.1 Group

texts.en:
Rock is a member of the community bank group La Delivrance 2.1 in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Helping to lead a subgroup of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs, Rock has been running his own car spare parts business for over 10 years. Rock has a dream of one day opening a series of spare parts shops throughout the city of Brazzaville, branching out from his current district, and eventually spreading to other cities. With just one small shop at present, Rock would like to take out a loan of 3,450,000 XAF with his community bank group through HOPE Congo. 

Rock is now on his fourth loan cycle with HOPE Congo since joining La Delivrance 2.1 in 2013, and will use his next loan to purchase additional motor pieces for commercial vehicles such as the buses and taxis that make up Brazzaville's public transportation. The father of two children, aged four and two, Rock’s dreams for his children are that they will be able to live well and be happy. He also hopes to be able to travel twice a year to purchase spare parts in person that he can bring back to sell.

loans.use: to purchase spare scrap parts for his used auto parts store.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called 'Greda', and are beginning their sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. The group is made up of two members. The businesses that these members carry out vary, including selling cooking oil (palm oil), cassava, yam, coco-yam, phone credit and wigs. The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro enterprises which Yaa is part of.

Yaa says that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food stuff (cassava, plantain, yam, coco-yam and palm oil) which she has been doing for 18 years. She says that she undertook this business at her own initiative, upon seeing that she has little competition in her area, but was desired by her neighbors. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital by purchasing more cassava, plantain, yam, coco-yam and palm oil in bulk. She will acquire these from the wholesalers in the city of Accra and sell them to her customers. This type of work permits her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she is married. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Yaa answers that she likes the savings program that the institution offers. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantain, yam, coco-yam and palm oil in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 11 años. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante ganándose la vida por medio de su trabajo en el cual presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. María desea reparar el muro de contención de su vivienda para lo cual ya cuenta con piedra como podemos observar pero le falta cemento y arena por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento y arena para reparar un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and has lived in her own home for the past 11 years. She is a very hardworking woman, and each day she puts in effort to get ahead. She makes a living through her work, in which she provides domestic services for different households.

Maria wants to repair a retaining wall at her home. She already has the stones, as you can see, but she does not have cement or sand. That is why she asking for this loan from FUSAI, in order to invest in cement and sand to repair the retaining wall at her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement and sand to repair a retaining wall at her home.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Rosa Maria describes herself as a person dedicated to her business. She is divorced and has three children, but only one lives with her. All of them are independent. She likes to work and spends almost all day in her store that is located inside a Mexico City market. Rosa Maria is asking for a loan to buy more school uniforms, because due to the back-to-school season, she sold all the ones that she had, and she needs to re-stock. Her business is near a school and most of her clients are students or their parents. She has many recurring clients and her sister and niece help her in managing the store.
She started the business eight years ago, and says that her biggest achievement is being able to provide education for her children. Her goal is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and uniforms.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Christo Nti which comprises three hardworking women. They are engaged in the sale of matches, candles, soap, washing powder and bags.
 
Elizabeth is 36 years old, married and lives in the town of Teshie in the greater Accra region of Ghana. For the past 6 years, she has been working hard selling soap and washing powder. To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan from ID Ghana to buy more soap and washing powder to sell to customers. This loan will help her to generate greater profits so that she can pay school fees for her children and also take care of her home. 

The members of the group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more soap and washing powder to sell to customers.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Yatta. She is married and has 2 children aged 23 and 10 years old. 

In 2002, Yatta established her frozen fish business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of herself and the children since their father had died. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business, although competition and the rainy season are her big challenges.

Yatta would like to take out a loan to the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to purchase cartons of frozen fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and improve and develop her business, so that she can educate her children and save some money for her retirement in the future. 

Working in this business has helped her to raise her children, and Yatta thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of frozen fish for resale

loans.name: Tarasisio

texts.en:
Tarasisio used his previous loan to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm. He deals in banana farming as his main source of income alongside being a businessman. He started these businesses in order to earn a living and look after his family. He still faces hardships of price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather changes. However he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and becoming a modernized farmer.

He is requesting for another loan to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a new client who has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX (two million only). He is single but has dependents - his mother and brother. He is an agriculturalist, mainly dealing in a poultry project and coffee farming. He works for 12 hours a day. He started this business in 2011 in Kasenyi Cell, Bushenyi District. He started farming so as to raise money for his personal development. 

Andrew says he will use these loan funds to buy more birds (chickens). He is assured of income because his customers are all categories of people including hotel owners, families and schools plus organizations, among others. His dream is to get enough capital, boost his farming business and start selling in bulk. He is honest and hopes to get good services from UGAFODE Microfinance LTD (MDI).

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is 50 years old, married and has three children. He started a grocery store 23 years ago, and he focuses on natural and healthy products. He is asking for a loan to re-stock some products for his store and also to build a credit history. His biggest accomplishment has been maintaining his business for many years and providing financial stability and education for his kids. His goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Kwamuka Group

texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and married to Robert, 53 years old. Together they have eight children who go to school. She runs a grocery store selling soap, sugar and biscuits, and is requesting this loan to order these items in large quantities to attract more customers in her village. She started her business to be able to pay school fees for her children and to accumulate money to start building a good iron-roofed house for her family.

Maria has been involved in the business for one year and before she started, she was a farmer. She works from home and her children help with the daily operations when they have time. Her ambition is to use any profit generated to satisfy her family's basic needs and to pay school fees for the children. Maria hopes that the training she received on Business Management offered by the Microloan Foundation will help her to achieve what she needs from her grocery store. As a woman, she is self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (three million shillings only). He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He has never taken a loan from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI). Jacob trades in cattle, goats, and sheep. He works for 10 hours a day. He has another source of income, matooke (green bananas), to supplement his monthly income. He started this business in 2008 in his local cell. However, at times he goes up to the neighboring places because of the demand. He started these businesses so as to raise money to educate his children. He sells the livestock to all categories of people, both agriculturalists and traders. 

He says he will use this loan funds to trade in goats and matooke. His dream is to buy a car and the main challenge he faces is traffic on the road while transporting his products. He is honest and he says UGAFODE MDI staff have good customer care.

loans.use: to buy goats and green bananas for trade.

loans.name: Adonaï (2) Group

texts.en:
Virginie is the leader. The single mother of four children, Virginie has long forged her own path to follow her dreams and provide for her family. Since studying fashion and tailoring at school, Virginie has had the dream of opening her own clothing line. In order to help achieve her dream, she joined the community bank group Adonai (2). Now the president of the group, Virginie leads a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo.

Virginie has been with HOPE Congo for five loan cycles now and would like to take out a loan of 400,000 CFA to continue to invest in her clothing studio. With this money she will be able to purchase additional fabric and other office supplies. Drawing in clients by showing off her custom-made clothes in her shop window, the quality of Virginie’s work is attested to by the fact that her business has been able to thrive purely by word of mouth. In the future Virginie hopes to be able to employ multiple people in her shop. She also dreams of being able to build a home for herself and her children with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and supplies for dressmaking in her clothing studio.

loans.name: Yan Fredy

texts.en:
Yan Fredy is an artisan from Peru who specializes in handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of semi-precious gemstones and sterling silver.

Yan Fredy has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My father designs and crafts jewelry, and he taught me to love the art of silver. I always loved being in his workshop with him. The old, with its infinite forms, icons and the techniques used by our ancestors… these are very interesting and special, due to our country's history and what this means for us Peruvians. The new has the versatility and perfect craftsmanship of a piece of jewelry. We must always seek innovation.

This microcredit is important to me, as it will allow me to be prepared for the upcoming holiday season. I'd like to thank each of you who contributes to this microcredit for helping me to continue growing my business."

Use the link below to view Yan Fredy's handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8369

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of semi-precious gemstones and sterling silver

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза добродушная девушка. Она живет с родителями в сельской местности. Дилнозе 18 лет. Она окончила среднюю школу успешно и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Теперь она студентка 1 курса и учится хорошо. Дилноза с детства любила читать книги. Теперь она каждый день после занятий посещает библиотеку, которая находится у нее в университете. Дилноза должна оплатить за учебный договор и поэтому она обратилась за займом в ИМОН КИВА. Ее отец несколько лет назад вернулся с России больным и ему нельзя выполнять тяжелый труд. Поэтому он открыл точку изготовления и продажи пирожка возле дома. Ее мать тоже занимается изготовлением пирожков. Дилноза и ее семья живут бедно и не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is a very kind young woman.  She lives with her parents in a rural area of Tajikistan. She is 18 years old and successfully completed secondary school.  She is now enrolled as a first-year student at the Tajik State University of Business and Politics.  She is a good student.  Ever since she was a child, Dilnoza always loved to read books.  Nowadays, she visits her university's library every day after her classes. 

Dilnoza needs to pay her tuition, and for this reason, she has turned to IMON and Kiva.  A few years ago, her father became ill and came back from Russia.  He can no longer do any type of heavy work.  He has opened a small retail outlet near the family's house and he makes and sells "pirozhki" (baked or fried buns).  Dilnoza's mother helps her husband with this small business.  Dilnoza and her family are poor and are not in a position to afford a college tuition.  Dilnoza is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Beishekan

texts.ru: Бейшекан успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бейшекан есть 4 теленка, 2 лошади и 30 овец. Также есть 1,00 ГА арендованной и 1,00 ГА собственной земли, где Бейшекан выращивает клевер и кукурузу. Дополнительно занимается торговлей в магазине, который Бейшекан открыла при доме. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бейшекан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40 000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. Доходы от кредита Бейшекан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет построить дом с большим сараем для скота.
texts.en: Beishekan successfully repaid her last loan and is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who has helped her with the financing. Today, Beishekan has 4 calves, 2 horses and 30 sheep. She also has 1.00 hectare of leased and 1.00 hectare of owned land, where she grows clover and corn. Additionally, Beishekan is involved in sales at a store that she opened at her house. Her family's monthly profit amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further grow her business, Beishekan requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy heifers. Beishekan plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further growing her business and wants to build a house with a large barn for livestock in the future.

loans.use: to buy heifers in order to grow her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like footwear, toys and other dry goods.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like footwear, toys and other dry goods.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 45 years old and four of her children are in school.

Rosemarie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Neide

texts.en:
Neide, originally from Brazil, came to the US in 2004. She has been working independently as a hair stylist since 2005. During these nine years, she has built a strong clientele at her business, a Brazilian-oriented, full-service hair salon, located in Wheaton, Maryland. This salon is a one-stop shop, including hair, nail, waxing, pedicure and massage services.

Now, Neide is working at the maximum of her space capacity, with an increasing clientele, so she has decided to expand. She is looking for a $10,000 loan to grow her salon, adding two more seats. With this expansion, she will be able to provide more services to more clients. She will also be creating jobs by hiring a second stylist and a part-time helper. This loan will be used to add the new spaces, including equipment, tools, and supplies and to perform the necessary electrical work.

loans.use: to pay for equipment, supplies and electrical work to add two more seats to her salon

loans.name: Tupu

texts.en: Tupu is 59 years old and married with 8 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tupu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, overalls, a machete, a spade and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Tupu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, overalls, a machete, a spade and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Remedios has a business selling seashells in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of seashells to make souvenirs.

Remedios has been in this business for two years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of seashells to make souvenirs.

loans.name: Alzira

texts.en: Alzira is applying for a loan of $1,000. She has a kiosk and she is a businesswoman. She is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including cooking oil, aqua, ketchup, toothpaste, notebooks, soft drinks and other things to sell. She started her business in 2010 with working capital of $350. She hopes to open a big store in the future, so her idea is to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because with the loan, she can improve her management for her business in the future, so her hopes to open a big store can be achieved.
