She is happy that the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin will provide her with more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy coffee, noodles, detergents, water, toothpaste, sugar, sweets, and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Jessielyn

texts.en:
Jessielyn is 39 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 school-age children. 

Jessielyn earns a living selling ready-to-wear clothing. She has been in this business for more than 6 years, in order to support her husband who is a cargo truck driver. Jessielyn earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothing, particularly dresses, shirts, and pants. Jessielyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, Jessielyn hopes to engage in direct-selling and multi-level marketing businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothing, particularly dresses, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Essénam

texts.fr:
_  - 
célibataire âgée de 23 ans, Essénam  réside à  Adidogomé. Elle vend  des produits alimentaires. Elle  s'approvisionne 2 fois  par mois au grand marché de lomé. Elle  revand a la devanture de son domicile. Essénam sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Essénam, aged 23, is unmarried and living in Adidogomé. She sells grocery items and gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She resells the goods in front of her house. Essénam is requesting this loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 3 containers of oil, 3 sacks of rice, and a box of soap

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
_ - 
Adjo âgée de  52 ans, veuve et mère  de 2 enfants résident à Adidogomé. Elle  vend  des  poissons. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois à la  frontière Togo-Ghana et revend dans le marché de BoKovi. Adjo sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Adjo, aged 52, is a widow and mother of two children living in Adidogomé. She sells fish and gets her supplies twice a month at the Togo-Ghana border, and she resell the goods at the BoKovi market. Adjo is requesting this loan to expand her commerce in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase four baskets of dried fish

loans.name: Hermilo Victor

texts.es:
Hermilo Victor tiene 26 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de sus padres, vive en casa propia de familia de material rustico de dos pisos en sector el Salluc, Hermilo Victor es nacido en caserío Tayales en el distrito de Santo Tomás, él se lleva bien con los miembros de su sector y comunidad, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Dicho caserio está ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Hermilo Victor es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en segundo año de producción tiene tres años de edad, cultiva café en caserío Tayales Sector el Salluc del distrito Santo Tomás, actividad la realiza hace 6 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros), también cultiva productos de pan llevar (maíz, menestras, yuca, plátanos y otros).

El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1,5 has. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hermilo Victor is 26 and a native of a small town called Tayales in Santo Tomás District. Santo Tomás is part of Cutervo Province in the Cajamarca Region in the northern Peruvian sierra. Hermilio Victor now lives with his parents in a sturdy, two-story home with running water that the family built themselves in the village of Salluc. 

Hermilio Victor is a well-known, liked, and respected member of his community. He has for the past six years earned a living growing coffee on a 1.5-hectare tract of land in Tayales. Three years ago, Hermilio Victor planted a disease-resistant variety of coffee plant, Catimor, and these plants are now in their second year of production. Hermilio Victor also raises small animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others), and a variety of crops besides coffee, including corn, lentils, yucca, and bananas.   

Hermilio Victor has excellent personal and business references. He is applying for a loan for the maintenance of his coffee crop so that he can ensure a strong harvest in 2015. Hermilio Victor hopes to boost sales and income so that he can raise his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his 1.5-hectare coffee crop and ensure a strong harvest.

loans.name: Mawulawè

texts.fr:
- 
Agée de 34 ans,  Mawulawè est  mariée  et  mère d’un  enfant  résidant  à Adidogomé. Elle a commencée  son activité  de  commerce en  vendant  de la boule du maïs .  Elle s'approvisionne  une fois  par mois au  marché assiyéyé  et  revend   a la  devanture de son domicile.  Mawulawè  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir  son  commerce  afin  de  satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Mawulawè, aged 34, is a married mother of one child residing in Adidogomé. She began her business by selling cornmeal dumplings. She gets her supplies once a month at the Assiyéyé market, and she makes her sales in front of her home. Mawulawè is requesting a loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of corn

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas continua dedicándose a la ganadería, la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo, gallinas y chanchos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.


La socia solicito el crédito para comprar gallinas.
La socia  agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues to make a living through cattle ranching, agriculture, and raising small animals, such as chickens and pigs. She has been running this business for quite some time and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens. Felicitas is infinitely thankful to all of the lenders that supported her through her previous loan because it helped with the capital of her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel continua con su negocio de venta de fruta, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de playanos, naranjas entre otros.
La socia  agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maribel continues with her business of selling fruit.  She has been working at this for quite a while, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. 

 Maribel wants to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting her family.  She is asking for a loan to buy plantains, oranges and other fruit.  She thanks the investors for the loan and is happy about the support being offered to her.

loans.use: to buy plantains and oranges as well as other fruit

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 04 hijos dependientes. Vive con sus hijos y su conyugue en el caserío de Ñuruñupe, en el distrito de San Felipe, el caserío de Ñuruñupe es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, el cual se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; en dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Remigio se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, de 05 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado, además se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno asi cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro de la agricultura, y también Remigio se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son yuca, frejol, etc. los cuales son para su consumo, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Remigio is 46 years old, is in a relationship and has four dependent children. He lives with his children and partner in the village of Ñuruñupe, in San Felipe district. The village of Ñuruñupe is medium size with ambitions of growing. It is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The main activities here are agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Remigio works in agriculture, He has coffee crops that are five years old on a farm with coffee plants in good condition. He also raises cattle. He has 10 years of working in agriculture. Remigio also grows basic foods like yucca, beans etc. which are for his own consumption. He has good personal and work references. The loan will be used in his business, maintaining his coffee crops and be able to get an acceptable profit to improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Virgilda

texts.en:
Virgilda has been earning from piggery for over seven years. Her income is good enough to sustain the needs of her child and the entire family. Her husband helps her in taking care of their pigs. 

With her generated revenue, she was able to repay successfully her previous loan used for buying feeds. Oftentimes, she sells pork meat in their village, especially on weekends. 

To boost her pigs, she took a new loan recently to purchase feeding supplies. In the future, she plans to make improvements to her house and also improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
Kenanga Indah group can repay the loan on time. Ni Komang, head of the group, tells her success in raising pigs. From the first loan she got from MUK, Ni Komang had one pig. But now she has five pigs. Ni Komang sells the pigs after maintaining them for six months. She also has a sow with six piglets. All profits she saves will be used for working capital so that she can be independent in terms of capital. 

Ni Komang is very grateful for the help she had received so far. Ni Komang still expects the assistance from MUK, both in terms of capital and training, so that she and all members of the group can be successful pig farmers.

After obtaining satisfactory results in previous loan period, the Kenanga Indah group continues borrowing. The current loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed, and to repair cages.

Ni Komang will use the loan to buy feed and repair cages. Ni Komang leaves six piglets for fattening, scheduled to be sold 5 months later. She hopes the welfare of her family will be better and if all goes well, she will stop borrowing and continue the business with her own money.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair cages

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol, age 43, is happy tending her little store. She is married with 1 child. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and she makes promising daily sales. Mirasol keeps on running the store well though there is increased competition from other stores. Mirasol believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will survive and beat the competition. 

Mirasol has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP to expand her inventory which will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hard working mother and wishes to sustain the store and provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to pay for sari-sari store items.

location.town: Dipolog-Sta.Isabel, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Namnan-Ochir

texts.en:
Namnan-Ochir, 38 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2008. His wife works at an insurance company. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to buy a plot of land in order to plant potatoes and raise livestock. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve his family's living standard and meet his children's growing need.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in order to plant potatoes and raise livestock

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 29 years old, married and has a child. She sells groceries to the people in her village. Genalyn earns 300 PHP  daily and reinvests in the business and buys meals for her family. 

Genalyn asks for a loan to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and sugar to sell. This will help to earn more income by stocking good products and offering friendly services.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. 

Lilian is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to restock the store with basic commodities like noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks . In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities like noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a responsible mother who requests a loan from PMPC which she will use to increase her inventory.  She earns well with selling fried chicken. She wants to buy more kilos of chicken for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 66 years old, a widow, and resident of Sto. Nino, Dapitan City. She earns a living through food vending and operating a motorcycle as a passenger vehicle.

She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy motor parts and accessories for her passenger motorcycle.

Rosita deeply wishes to maintain her status of a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for the accesories and motor parts of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Hector

texts.es:
Juan Hector vive con su conyuge y su menor hijo, en casa propia. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es unida. Juan Hector vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubciada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juan Hector se dedica a la venta de leche fresca y a la compra y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para compra de cerdos y alimentacion balanceado de engorde para los animales y asi poder venderlos después a un mejor precio, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Hector lives with his common-law partner and his youngest son at a house he owns. He has good personal and work references. He has a tight-knit family. Juan Hector lives in a community which makes a living from commerce, agriculture and livestock. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Juan Hector makes a living from selling fresh milk, and buying and selling pigs, for about more than 5 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy pigs and a balanced nutrition to fatten livestock so Juan Hector can sell them at a better price, improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a balanced nutrition to fatten livestock

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She is a farmer in R. J. Macias and borrowed a loan to begin her vegetable production business. After several months, she was able to repay the loan. To this day, Lorena feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

She requests a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the next crop season. Lorena wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
La socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maribel is continuing her business selling clothes. She is having a good time with her business, which is doing well thanks to the effort she makes every day. She wants to keep working so she can support her family.

Maribel is requesting a loan to buy dress coats and other items. She is grateful to lenders for the loan and is happy for the help they provide.

loans.use: to buy dress coats and other items.

loans.name: Jounalyn

texts.en:
Jounalyn is 33 years old. She is known in the Liloy area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan for a kitchen renovation. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a micro-finance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for a kitchen renovation.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is married and has a young child. To make a living, he manages a small panciteria to  cook and sell pancit (noodles with eggs and vegetables) to villagers. He is a good cook and has many customers. Dante want to improve his income and requests  13,000 PHP to invest in his business. He will buy eggs, miki (noodles) meat,  and vegetables to cook. 

Someday, he hopes to improve his food stall and diversify his business iinto a larger panciteria.

loans.use: to buy eggs, miki (noodles) meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Pailino

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose al  negocio de cortar árboles, con la construcción de casas y con la agricultura, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma a seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Pailino continues working in the business of cutting trees, building homes, and farming. He is a responsible and enterprising person. He wants to keep working so he can support his family.

Pailino is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other items. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other items.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna operates a motor transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

For her to continue her business, she availed a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for motor spare parts, repair, and maintenance. Lorna dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts, repair, and maintenance

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is a hardworking woman with four children.  Maryjane enjoys her retail business. Her husband is a tricycle driver in Diwait, Jose Dalman, Sindangan, Philippines.  He is able to earn an income and  pay the monthly payment.

Maryjane runs a store to support  their family. She never tires of working in her store. She is a  member of PMPC and has had several previous loans. She successfully repaid her obligations without default. She requests 50,000 PHP to restock her store with rice, canned goods, and school supplies. An increased  inventory would mean greater income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family and achieve a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, and school supplies.

location.town: Sindangan - Diwait, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 61 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a restaurant. Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and  works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and earns additional income operating a general store.  Gloria requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Gloria has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult and school age.
 
Rosa has been earning a living from a snack-vending business, particularly suman (rice cakes), for more than seven years already in support of her husband who is a carpenter. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional ingredients, particularly sugar, malagkit (sticky)  rice, and other ingredients, for her suman-making business. Rosa has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her suman-making business to other towns.

loans.use: To be used for purchasing additional ingredients, particularly sugar, malagkit rice, and other ingredients, for suman-making

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 66 years old, lives in Lagag, Sindangan, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. She was gifted with five children. Farming is their main source to earn a living. Virginia has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodity. 

In need of additional working capital, Virginia decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 10,000 for buying farm fertilizers and pesticides and for paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family.  Virginia is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation and wishes to have a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia has been a member of the Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative for 2 years.  She wishes to use the various products and services of the Cooperative.  She and her husband have been operating a tricycle transportation service  for 10 years. 

They have 5 children and 2 attend college. She is applying for a loan to buy tires, tubes, and a battery. Her future plan is to upgrade her motorcycle  and purchase an additional one to continue the business for several years. This will help her to provide a higher quality of life for their children's future.

loans.use: to buy tires, tubes, and a battery.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is married with 2 adult children. One child is a college graduate and is  reviewing for the upcoming nursing exam. Margie is a very supportive mother who wishes to support the educational needs of her children. 

Margie is a member of PMPC  and requests a loan to pay her daughter's nursing licensure examination fee.  Margie wants a good future for her children.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's  nursing licensure examination fee.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman who has two children. She is 50 years old and served as the village captain in  Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

She has been selling assorted jewelry for over five years and it helps a lot, aside from their farm. Her previous loan, used for buying stocks of jewelry and accessories, was repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently to purchase more ladies' accessories to sell. She used her income in improving their house and wants to see her children's success in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' accessories to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is from Diwait, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old. Linda and her partner have five adult married children  with their own families. 

She joined Paglaum MPC in 2013 and appreciates the co-pr's programs and services. She desired to earn additional income and  has sold fish  for 2 years. 

She requests 5,000.00 PHP financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to purchase  fish. She hopes to increase her income and provide for their daily needs.  She is happy to support her grandchildren, which are her inspiration.

loans.use: to purchase  fish to sell.

location.town: Sindangan - Diwait, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Jose Osmar

texts.es:
Jose Osmar tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, posee dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, dedicado a la cría y comercio de animales menores, así como a las labores de agrícolas, la casa de Jose Osmar se encuentra en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Jose Osmar se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales menores(cerdos, patos, chivos, gallinas, pollos, netre otros), desde hace 10 años en el caserío San José. Él necesita del crédito para la construcción de corrales así como invertir en el comercio de animales para poder aumentar su stock y también para diversificarlo. Con la construcción de corrales tendrá mayor comodidad para poder criar sus animales en mejores condiciones y mas saludables, lo que le permitirá venderlos a un mejor precio, mejorando sus ganancias y por ende su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Osmar is 36 years old, lives with his partner and has two children in his care. He makes a living by raising and selling small animals, as well as agricultural work. Jose Osmar's house is located in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca and north sierra of Peru.

Jose Osmar has made a living by raising and selling small animals (pigs, ducks, goats, hens and chicken, among others) in the hamlet of San José for the last ten years. He needs the loan to build pens to invest in his animal business so he can increase and also diversify his stock. With the construction of the pens he will have greater comfort to be able to raise his animals in better and healthier conditions, which will allow him to sell them at a better price, improving his earnings and thus his quality of life.

loans.use: to build pens to invest in his animal business so he can increase and also diversify his stock.

loans.name: Tseren

texts.en:
Tseren has used her previous loan to insulate her house. Last winter, her family burned less coal compared to other households. 

She requests a new loan of 1,000,000 MNT to install insulated windows in order to further preserve energy. The new windows will be more energy efficient and her family will no longer need to burn coal for heating.

loans.use: to install insulated windows in order to preserve energy.

loans.name: Tivalo

texts.en:
Tivalo is a 57-year-old widow with five children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years. 

She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, chemicals, a new watering hose, a sprinkler, and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Tivalo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gloves, chemicals, a new watering hose, a sprinkler, and a tiller

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 57 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 23 y 20 años de edad quienes le ayudan en la siembras, Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus cultivos para generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge, 57, has been working in agriculture for the past 20 years planting corn and sorghum. He sells his products in the different markets that are found hear his house. He lives in his own house with his wife and their two children, 23 and 20 years old, who help him with the plantings. Jorge is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. and will therefore continue with his crops to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is 39 years old and happily married to her husband who works as a driver. God blessed them with four loving children. She and her husband are helping each other in working so they can give their family a good future.

Jenneth owns a computer shop. These computers are rented for PHP 20.00 per hour. Still, some families don’t have their own computers so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad and others, especially the children and the youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8 AM and close at 7 PM. Her regular customers are the children and youth of their community. She earns PHP 400 a day. Aside from this, Jenneth also buys and sells frozen food products and she likewise offers mineral water which they deliver to their customers.

Just as any other business owners, she is also hoping that her shop will continue to expand and have more customers and branches. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: Donald de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Donald está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Donald, 33, lives in his own house with a life partner and their two children. He has worked cultivating corn and beans for many years. He sells his products in the nearby places in the area. He achieves affording the expenses of his home with what he obtains from his sales. Donald is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. and will therefore be able to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Arhie

texts.en:
Arhie is 23, a single mother who wants to become a teacher in the future. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. 

She studies for the Bachelor of Science in Education in a public school in their village. Her father earns income from working as a hired-hand carpenter. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC micro finance to fully pay off her tuition fees for the first semester. Hoping to become successful in the future, she focused in her study and was determined to improve the general situation of her family.

loans.use: to fully pay off her tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El  joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 14 años, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida quien le ayuda a la venta de pescado y sus tres hijos, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de trasmallos y redes y  poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, who has had his face pixelated because he is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has made a living from traditional fishing for 14 years. He lives in his own home with his life partner, who helps him to sell fish, and their three children. 

The young man is requesting a loan for the purchase of trammels and nets to be able to continue with his work since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fish trammels and nets.

loans.name: Filecesema

texts.en:
Filecesema is a married woman with 4 children who works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income selling vegetables.  Filecesema requests 9,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Filecesema has sustained her business activities with six previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 46 years old and married with three children who are all in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erna has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling personal products.

She aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Cherry works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Cherry is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas desde hace 6 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y por los buenos precios, Ana está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más ropa por mayor y así surtir su negocio y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 31, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, 13 and 9 years of age. She has been working selling women's underwear for the past 6 years. She has her business located in the market that's found near her house. She has a large clientele because of the variety of products and the good prices. Ana is applying for a loan to be able to buy more clothing in bulk and therefore stock her business and be able to have more income.

loans.use: to buy underwear in bulk.

loans.name: Roxana Noemy

texts.es: Roxana de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 6 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene clientela ya establecida por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Roxana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, shampoo, etc. y así continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Roxana, 37 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has been making a living from the sale of products for personal use for the last 6 years. She has her business in her residence, but also sells door-to-door in different neighbourhoods. She has recurring customers because of the quality of her products and her good prices.

Roxana is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorant, shampoo, etc., which she will use to continue with her sales, which earn her a good profit.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorant, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana sigue dedicándose a la  elaboración de pan ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de harina entre otros. 


La socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana continues working making bread. The member has been doing her business for a while, which is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day to her business. The member wishes to be able to continue working to, in this manner, continue supporting her family.

The member is applying for the loan for the purchase of flour and other supplies.

The member is thankful for the investors for the loan and she feels content for the support given.

loans.use: to buy flour and other supplies.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has always dreamed of opening her own Internet cafe to support her two children. She used her loan to buy computer accessories to answer clients' demands. 

She deeply wishes to fully repay her loan in a timely manner and she hopes maintain a good credit record with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, meats, rice, beans, vegetables, fruits, seafood, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a water refilling station. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell to customers. 

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо добрая женщина. Она родилась в 1956 году. Точинисо в течение многих лет работает бухгалтером в государственном учреждении. Ее муж Кобил тоже бухгалтер. Они имеет 3 детей. Двое старшие дети семейные и живут отдельно. Точинисо живет с мужем и младшей дочерью Барно. Барно 17 лет и она окончила в этом году среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Точинисо должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и поэтому обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Tojiniso is a good woman. She was born in 1956. Tojiniso has worked as an accountant at a state office for many years. Her husband, Kobil, is also an accountant. They have three children. The two eldest children have families and live separately. 

Tojiniso lives together with her husband and the youngest daughter Barno. Barno is 17 years old. She finished high school this year and entered the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. Tojiniso needs to pay for her daughter's tuition, and therefore she applies for a loan. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her daughter
